<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Our business and affairs are overseen by our Board of Directors pursuant to the North Carolina Business
Corporation Act and our By-Laws. The Board of Directors has three separately designated standing committees: Audit, Compensation and Nominating and Corporate Governance. The charters of these committees are available free of charge on our website at
<U>http://www.pepsico.com</U>. The names of each of our Audit Committee members are contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the caption &#147;Committees of the Board of Directors&#148; and is incorporated
herein by reference. Information on our Audit Committee and Audit Committee financial expertise and financial literacy is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;The Audit Committee&#148;
and &#147;Financial Expertise and Financial Literacy&#148; and is incorporated herein by reference. The names of each of our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee members are contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of
Shareholders under the caption &#147;Committees of the Board of Directors&#148; and are incorporated herein by reference. Information on our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and director nomination process can be found in our Proxy
Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee&#148; and &#147;Director Nomination Process&#148; and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc26997_19"></A>Item&nbsp;11. Executive Compensation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on compensation of our directors and executive officers and Compensation Committee interlocks is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;2008
Director Compensation,&#148; &#147;Executive Compensation,&#148; and &#147;Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation,&#148; respectively, and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The names of each of our Compensation Committee members are contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the
caption &#147;Committees of the Board of Directors&#148; and are incorporated herein by reference. Information on our Compensation Committee can be found under the caption &#147;The Compensation Committee&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2009
Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated by reference herein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc26997_20"></A>Item&nbsp;12. Security Ownership of
Certain Beneficial Owners and Management and Related Stockholder Matters </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information with respect to securities authorized for issuance
under equity compensation plans can be found under the caption &#147;Securities Authorized for Issuance Under Equity Compensation Plans&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">125 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on the number of shares of PepsiCo Common Stock beneficially owned by each director and named
executive officer and by all directors and executive officers as a group is contained under the caption &#147;Ownership of PepsiCo Common Stock by Directors and Executive Officers&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of
Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference. As far as we know, no person beneficially owns more than 5% of the outstanding shares of PepsiCo Common or Convertible Preferred Stock. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc26997_21"></A>Item&nbsp;13. Certain Relationships and Related Transactions, and Director Independence </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Transactions with Related Persons</I></B>. Information with respect to transactions with related persons, if any, is contained under the caption &#147;Review and Approval of Transactions
with Related Persons&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B><I>Review, Approval or Ratification of Transactions with Related Persons</I></B>. Information with respect to the review, approval or ratification of transactions with related persons is contained under the caption &#147;Review and
Approval of Transactions with Related Persons&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Promoters and Certain Control Persons</I></B>. Not applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Director Independence</I></B>.
The name of each director that is independent is contained under the caption &#147;Director Independence&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2009 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc26997_22"></A>Item&nbsp;14. Principal Accountant Fees and Services </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on our Audit Committee&#146;s pre-approval policy for audit services, and information on our principal accountant fees and services is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2009
Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;Audit Committee Report&#148; and &#147;Audit and Non-Audit Fees,&#148; and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;
</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">126 </FONT></P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">iii </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE I </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Foreword </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The PepsiCo Pension Equalization Plan (&#147;PEP&#148; or
&#147;Plan&#148;) has been established by PepsiCo for the benefit of salaried employees of the PepsiCo Organization who participate in the PepsiCo Salaried Employees Retirement Plan (&#147;Salaried Plan&#148;). PEP provides benefits for eligible
employees whose pension benefits under the Salaried Plan are limited by the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. In addition, PEP provides benefits for certain eligible employees based on the pre-1989 Salaried Plan formula.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Plan was last amended and restated in its entirety effective as of January&nbsp;1, 1989, and this restatement was
subsequently amended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This document is effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2005 (the &#147;Effective Date&#148;). It sets
forth the terms of the Plan that are applicable to benefits that are subject to Section&nbsp;409A, <I>i.e</I>., generally, benefits that are earned or vested after December&nbsp;31, 2004 (the &#147;409A Program&#148;). All other benefits under the
Plan shall be governed by the document referenced in the preceding paragraph, which sets forth the pre-Section&nbsp;409A terms of the Plan (the &#147;Pre-409A Program&#148;). Together, this document and the document for the Pre-409A Program describe
the terms of a single plan. However, amounts subject to the terms of this 409A Program and amounts subject to the terms of the Pre-409A Program shall be tracked separately at all times. The preservation of the terms of the Pre-409A Program, without
material modification, and the separation between the 409A Program amounts and the Pre-409A Program amounts are intended to be sufficient to permit the pre-409A Program to remain exempt from Section&nbsp;409A as grandfathered benefits. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">I-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(nn)</FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(pp)</FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(qq)</FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(rr)</FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-16</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(tt)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-17</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(uu)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Taxable Wage Base</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-17</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(vv)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Vested Pension</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-17</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Where the following words and phrases, in boldface and underlined, appear in this Plan (including
the Foreword) with initial capitals they shall have the meaning set forth below, unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <B><U>Accrued Benefit</U></B>: The Pension payable at Normal Retirement Date determined in accordance with Article&nbsp;V, based on the Participant&#146;s Highest Average Monthly Earnings and
Credited Service at the date of determination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <B><U>Actuarial Equivalent</U></B>: Except as otherwise
specifically set forth in the Plan or any Appendix to the Plan with respect to a specific benefit determination, a benefit of equivalent value computed on the basis of the factors set forth below. The application of the following assumptions to the
computation of benefits payable under the Plan shall be done in a uniform and consistent manner. In the event the Plan is amended to provide new rights, features or benefits, the following actuarial factors shall not apply to these new elements
unless specifically adopted by the amendment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Annuities and Inflation Protection</U>: To determine
the amount of a Pension payable in the form of a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity or optional form of survivor annuity, as an annuity with inflation protection, or as a period certain and life annuity, the Plan Administrator shall </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">select the factors that are to be used. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2009, the initial factors selected by the Plan Administrator are set forth in Schedule 1,
below (prior factors appear in the Appendix). Thereafter, the Plan Administrator shall review such initial factors from time to time and shall amend such factors in its discretion. A Participant shall have no right to have any of the actuarial
factors specified under the Plan from time to time applied to his benefit (or any portion thereof), except to the extent that a particular factor is currently in effect at the time it is to be applied under the Plan. For the avoidance of doubt, it
is expressly intended and binding upon Participants that any actuarial factors selected by the Plan Administrator from time-to-time may be applied retroactively to already accrued benefits, and without regard to the actuarial factors that may have
applied previously for such purpose. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>SCHEDULE 1 </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="34%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24pt" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Date</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Mortality Table Factors</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Interest Rate Factor</B></FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">January&nbsp;1, 2009-Present</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">GAR 94</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5%</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Lump Sums</U>: To determine the lump sum value of a
Pension, or a Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension under Section&nbsp;4.6, the factors applicable for such purposes under the Salaried Plan shall apply. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) <U>Other Cases</U>: To determine the adjustment to be made in the Pension payable to or on behalf of a Participant in other cases, the factors are those applicable for such purpose under the
Salaried Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <B><U>Annuity</U></B>: A Pension payable as a series of monthly payments for at least
the life of the Participant. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(d) <B><U>Annuity Starting Date</U></B>: The Annuity Starting Date shall
be the first day of the first period for which an amount is payable under this Plan as an annuity or in any other form. A Participant who: (1)&nbsp;is reemployed after his initial Annuity Starting Date, and (2)&nbsp;is entitled to benefits hereunder
after his reemployment, shall have a subsequent Annuity Starting Date for such benefits only to the extent provided in Section&nbsp;6.3(b). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(e) <B><U>Code</U></B>: The Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time. All references herein to particular Code Sections shall also refer to any successor provisions and shall
include all related regulations, interpretations and other guidance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(f) <B><U>Company</U></B>: PepsiCo,
Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of North Carolina or its successor or successors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(g) <B><U>Covered Compensation</U></B>: &#147;Covered Compensation&#148; as that term is defined in the Salaried Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(h) <B><U>Credited Service</U></B>: The period of a Participant&#146;s employment, calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.3, which is counted for purposes of determining the amount of
benefits payable to, or on behalf of, the Participant. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <B><U>Disability Retirement Pension</U></B>:
The Retirement Pension available to a Participant under Section&nbsp;4.5. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(j) <B><U>Early 409A Retirement
Pension</U></B>: The 409A Retirement Pension available to a Participant under Section&nbsp;4.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(k)
<B><U>Effective Date</U></B>: The date upon which this document for the 409A Program is effective, January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2005. Certain identified provisions of the 409A Program or the Plan may be effective on different dates, to the extent noted
herein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(l) <B><U>Elapsed Time Service</U></B>: The period of time beginning
with a Participant&#146;s first date of employment with the PepsiCo Organization and ending with the Participant&#146;s Final Separation from Service, irrespective of any breaks in service between those two dates. By way of illustration, if a
Participant began employment with the PepsiCo Organization on January&nbsp;1, 2000, left the employment of the PepsiCo Organization from January&nbsp;1, 2001 until December&nbsp;31, 2004, and was then reemployed by the PepsiCo Organization on
January&nbsp;1, 2005 until he had a Final Separation from Service on December&nbsp;31, 2008, the Participant would have eight years of Elapsed Time Service as of his Final Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(m) <B><U>Eligible Spouse</U></B>: The spouse of a Participant to whom the Participant is married on the earlier of the
Participant&#146;s Annuity Starting Date or the date of the Participant&#146;s death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(n)
<B><U>Employee</U></B>: An individual who qualifies as an &#147;Employee&#148; as that term is defined in the Salaried Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(o) <B><U>Employer</U></B>: An entity that qualifies as an &#147;Employer&#148; as that term is defined in the Salaried Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(p) <B><U>ERISA</U></B>: Public Law No.&nbsp;93-406, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, including any amendments thereto, any similar subsequent federal laws, and any rules and
regulations from time to time in effect under any of such laws. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(q) <B><U>FICA Amount</U></B>: The
Participant&#146;s share of the Federal Insurance Contributions Act (FICA) tax imposed on the 409A Pension and Pre-409A Pension of the Participant under Code Sections 3101, 3121(a) and 3121(v)(2). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(r) <B><U>409A Program</U></B>: The program described in this document.
The term &#147;409A Program&#148; is used to identify the portion of the Plan that is subject to Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">(s) <B><U>Highest Average Monthly Earnings</U></B>: &#147;Highest Average Monthly Earnings&#148; as that term is defined in the Salaried Plan, but without regard to the limitation imposed by section 401(a)(17) of the Code (as such
limitation is interpreted and applied under the Salaried Plan). Notwithstanding the foregoing, to the extent that a Participant receives, during a leave of absence, earnings that would be counted as Highest Average Monthly Earnings if they were
received during a period of active service, but that will be received after the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service, the Plan Administrator may provide for determining the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension at Separation from Service by
projecting the benefit the Participant would have if all such earnings were taken into account under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">(t) <B><U>Key Employee</U></B>: The individuals identified in accordance with the following paragraphs. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">(1) <U>In General</U>. Any Participant who at any time during the applicable year is: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) An
officer of any member of the PepsiCo Organization having annual compensation greater than $130,000 (as adjusted for the applicable year under Code Section&nbsp;416(i)(1)); </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) A 5-percent owner of any member of the PepsiCo Organization; or </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iii) A 1-percent owner of any member of the PepsiCo Organization having annual compensation of more than $150,000.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For purposes of subparagraph (i)&nbsp;above, no more than 50 employees identified in the
order of their annual compensation shall be treated as officers. For purposes of this Section, annual compensation means compensation as defined in Treas. Reg. &#167;1.415(c)-2(a), without regard to Treas. Reg. &#167;&#167;1.415(c)-2(d),
1.415(c)-2(e), and 1.415(c)-2(g). The Plan Administrator shall determine who is a Key Employee in accordance with Code Section&nbsp;416(i) (provided, that Code Section&nbsp;416(i)(5) shall not apply in making such determination), and provided
further than the applicable year shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;409A and that any modification of the foregoing definition that applies under Section&nbsp;409A shall be taken into account. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Applicable Year</U>. Effective from and after December&nbsp;31, 2007, the Plan Administrator shall determine Key
Employees effective as of the last day of each calendar year, based on compensation for such year, and such designation shall be effective for purposes of this Plan for the twelve-month period commencing on April&nbsp;1</FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>st</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"> of the next following calendar year (<I>e.g.</I>, the Key Employee determination by the Plan Administrator as of December&nbsp;31, 2008 shall apply to the
period from April&nbsp;1, 2009 to March&nbsp;31, 2010). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) <U>Rule of Administrative Convenience</U>.
Effective from and after December&nbsp;31, 2007, in addition to the foregoing, the Plan Administrator shall treat all other employees classified as Band IV and above on the applicable determination date prescribed in paragraph (2)&nbsp;(<I>i.e.</I>,
the period commencing on April&nbsp;1</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>st</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"> of the next following calendar year) as Key Employees for purposes of </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">the Plan for the twelve-month period commencing on April&nbsp;1</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>st</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"> of the next following calendar year; provided that if this would result in counting more than 200 individuals as Key Employees as of any such determination date, then the number treated as Key Employees will be reduced to 200 by
eliminating from consideration those employees otherwise added by this paragraph (3)&nbsp;in order by their base compensation, from the lowest to the highest. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(u) <B><U>Late Retirement Date</U></B>: The Late Retirement Date shall be the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following a Participant&#146;s actual Retirement Date occurring
after his Normal Retirement Age. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(v) <B><U>Late 409A Retirement Pension</U></B>: The 409A Retirement
Pension available to a Participant under Section&nbsp;4.4. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(w) <B><U>Normal Retirement Age</U></B>: The
Normal Retirement Age under the Plan is age 65 or, if later, the age at which a Participant first has 5 Years of Elapsed Time Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(x) <B><U>Normal Retirement Date</U></B>: A Participant&#146;s Normal Retirement Date shall be the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following a Participant&#146;s Normal Retirement Age.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(y) <B><U>Normal 409A Retirement Pension</U></B>: The Retirement Pension available to a Participant under
Section&nbsp;4.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(z) <B><U>Participant</U></B>: An Employee participating in the Plan in accordance with
the provisions of Section&nbsp;3.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(aa) <B><U>Pension</U></B>: One or more payments that are payable by
the Plan to a person who is entitled to receive benefits under the Plan. The term &#147;409A Pension&#148; shall </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">be used to refer to the portion of a Pension that is derived from the 409A Program. The term &#147;Pre-409A Pension&#148; shall be used to refer to the
portion of a Pension that is derived from the Pre-409A Program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(bb) <B><U>PepsiCo Organization</U></B>:
The controlled group of organizations of which the Company is a part, as defined by Code section 414 and regulations issued thereunder. An entity shall be considered a member of the PepsiCo Organization only during the period it is one of the group
of organizations described in the preceding sentence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(cc) <B><U>Plan</U></B>: The PepsiCo Pension
Equalization Plan, the Plan set forth herein and in the Pre-409A Program document(s), as the Plan may be amended from time to time (subject to the limitations on amendment that are applicable hereunder and under the Pre-409A Program). The Plan is
also sometimes referred to as PEP, or as the PepsiCo Pension Benefit Equalization Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(dd) <B><U>Plan
Administrator</U></B>: The PepsiCo Administration Committee (PAC), which shall have authority to administer the Plan as provided in Article VII. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ee) <B><U>Plan Year</U></B>: The 12-month period commencing on January&nbsp;1 and ending on December&nbsp;31. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ff) <B><U>Pre-409A Program</U></B>: The portion of the Plan that governs deferrals that are not subject to
Section&nbsp;409A. The terms of the Pre-409A Program are set forth in a separate document (or separate set of documents). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(gg) <B><U>Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension</U></B>: The Pension available to an Eligible Spouse under the Plan. The term &#147;Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension&#148; shall be used to refer to the Pension
available to an Eligible Spouse under Section&nbsp;4.6 of this document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(hh) <B><U>Primary Social Security Amount</U></B>: In determining
Pension amounts, Primary Social Security Amount shall mean: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) For purposes of determining the amount of
a Retirement, Vested or Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension, the Primary Social Security Amount shall be the estimated monthly amount that may be payable to a Participant commencing at age 65 as an old-age insurance benefit under the provisions of
Title&nbsp;II of the Social Security Act, as amended. Such estimates of the old-age insurance benefit to which a Participant would be entitled at age 65 shall be based upon the following assumptions: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) That the Participant&#146;s social security wages in any year prior to Retirement or Separation from Service are
equal to the Taxable Wage Base in such year, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) That he will not receive any social security wages
after Retirement or Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">However, in computing a Vested Pension under Formula A of Section&nbsp;5.2,
the estimate of the old-age insurance benefit to which a Participant would be entitled at age 65 shall be based upon the assumption that he continued to receive social security wages until age 65 at the same rate as the Taxable Wage Base in effect
at his Separation from Service. For purposes of this subsection, &#147;social security wages&#148; shall mean wages within the meaning of the Social Security Act. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) For purposes of determining the amount of a Disability Pension, the
Primary Social Security Amount shall be (except as provided in the next sentence) the initial monthly amount actually received by the disabled Participant as a disability insurance benefit under the provisions of Title II of the Social Security Act,
as amended and in effect at the time of the Participant&#146;s Retirement due to disability. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, for any period that a Participant receives a Disability Pension before receiving a disability insurance benefit
under the provisions of Title II of the Social Security Act, then the Participant&#146;s Primary Social Security Amount for such period shall be determined pursuant to paragraph (1)&nbsp;above. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) For purposes of paragraphs (1)&nbsp;and (2), the Primary Social Security Amount shall exclude amounts that may be
available because of the spouse or any dependent of the Participant or any amounts payable on account of the Participant&#146;s death. Estimates of Primary Social Security Amounts shall be made on the basis of the Social Security Act as in effect at
the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service, without regard to any increases in the social security wage base or benefit levels provided by such Act which take effect thereafter. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <B><U>Prohibited Misconduct</U></B>: Any of the following activities engaged in, directly or indirectly, by a
Participant shall constitute Prohibited Misconduct: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) The Participant accepting any employment,
assignment, position or responsibility, or acquiring any ownership interest, which involves the Participant&#146;s &#147;Participation&#148; (as defined below) in a business entity that markets, sells, distributes or produces &#147;Covered
Products&#148; (as defined below), unless such business entity makes retail sales or consumes Covered Products without in any way competing with the PepsiCo Organization. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;
</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) The Participant, directly or indirectly (including through someone
else acting on the Participant&#146;s recommendation, suggestion, identification or advice), soliciting any PepsiCo Organization employee to leave the PepsiCo Organization&#146;s employment or to accept any position with any other entity.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) The Participant using or disclosing to anyone any confidential information regarding the PepsiCo
Organization other than as necessary in his or her position with the PepsiCo Organization. Such confidential information shall include all non-public information the Participant acquired as a result of his or her positions with the PepsiCo
Organization which might be of any value to a competitor of the PepsiCo Organization, or which might cause any economic loss or substantial embarrassment to the PepsiCo Organization or its customers, bottlers, distributors or suppliers if used or
disclosed. Examples of such confidential information include non-public information about the PepsiCo Organization&#146;s customers, suppliers, distributors and potential acquisition targets; its business operations and structure; its product lines,
formulas and pricing; its processes, machines and inventions; its research and know-how; its financial data; and its plans and strategies. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(4) The Participant engaging in any acts that are considered to be contrary to the PepsiCo Organization&#146;s best interests, including violating the Company&#146;s Code of Conduct, engaging in
unlawful trading in the securities of the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Company or of any other company based on information gained as a result of his or her employment with the PepsiCo Organization, or engaging in any other
activity which constitutes gross misconduct. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(5) The Participant engaging in any activity that
constitutes fraud. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For purposes of this subsection, &#147;Participation&#148; shall be construed broadly to include:
(i)&nbsp;serving as a director, officer, employee, consultant or contractor with respect to such a business entity; (ii)&nbsp;providing input, advice, guidance or suggestions to such a business entity; or (iii)&nbsp;providing a recommendation or
testimonial on behalf of such a business entity or one or more products it produces. For purposes of this subsection, &#147;Covered Products&#148; shall mean any product that falls into one or more of the following categories, so long as the PepsiCo
Organization is producing, marketing, selling or licensing such product anywhere in the world &#150; beverages, including without limitation carbonated soft drinks, tea, water, juice drinks, sports drinks, coffee drinks and value-added dairy drinks;
juices and juice products; snacks, including salty snacks, sweet snacks meat snacks, granola and cereal bars, and cookies; hot cereals; pancake mixes; value-added rice products; pancake syrups; value-added pasta products; ready-to-eat cereals; dry
pasta products; or any product or service that the Participant had reason to know was under development by the PepsiCo Organization during the Participant&#146;s employment with the PepsiCo Organization. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(jj) <B><U>Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity</U></B>: An Annuity which is payable to the Participant for life with 50
percent of the amount of such Annuity payable after the Participant&#146;s death to his surviving Eligible Spouse for life. If the Eligible </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-13 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Spouse predeceases the Participant, no survivor benefit under a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity shall be payable to any person. The amount of a
Participant&#146;s monthly payment under a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity shall be reduced to the extent provided in Sections 5.1 and 5.2, as applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(kk) <B><U>Retirement</U></B>: Separation from Service for reasons other than death after a Participant has fulfilled the requirements for either a Normal, Early, Late, or Disability Retirement
Pension under Article IV. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ll) <B><U>Retirement Date</U></B>: The date immediately following the
Participant&#146;s Retirement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(mm) <B><U>Retirement Pension</U></B>: The Pension payable to a Participant
upon Retirement under the Plan. The term &#147;409A Retirement Pension&#148; shall be used to refer to the portion of a Retirement Pension that is derived from the 409A Program. The term &#147;Pre-409A Retirement Pension&#148; shall be used to refer
to the portion of a Retirement Pension that is derived from the Pre-409A Program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(nn) <B><U>Salaried
Plan</U></B>: The PepsiCo Salaried Employees Retirement Plan, as it may be amended from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(oo)
<B><U>Section&nbsp;409A</U></B>: Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(pp) <B><U>Separation from
Service</U></B>: A Participant&#146;s separation from service with the PepsiCo Organization, within the meaning of Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(A)(i). The term may also be used as a verb (<I>i.e.</I>, &#147;Separates from Service&#148;) with no change in
meaning. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, a Participant&#146;s transfer to an entity owned 20% or more by the Company will not constitute a Separation of Service to the extent permitted by Section&nbsp;409A. A Participant&#146;s &#147;Final
Separation from Service&#148; is the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-14 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">date of his Separation from Service that most recently precedes his Annuity Starting Date; provided, however, that to the extent a Participant is reemployed
after an Annuity Starting Date, he will have a new Final Separation from Service with respect to any benefits to which he becomes entitled as a result of his reemployment. The following principles shall generally apply in determining when a
Separation from Service occurs: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) A Participant separates from service with the Company if the Employee
dies, retires, or otherwise has a termination of employment with the Company. Whether a termination of employment has occurred is determined based on whether the facts and circumstance indicate that the Company and the Employee reasonably
anticipated that no further services would be performed after a certain date or that the level of bona fide services the Employee would perform after such date (as an employee or independent contractor) would permanently decrease to no more than 20
percent of the average level of bona fide services performed over the immediately preceding 36-month period (or the full period in which the Employee provided services to the Company if the Employee has been providing services for less than 36
months). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) An Employee will not be deemed to have experienced a Separation from Service if such
Employee is on military leave, sick leave, or other bona fide leave of absence, to the extent such leave does not exceed a period of six months or, if longer, such longer period of time during which a right to re-employment is protected by either
statute or contract. If the period of leave exceeds six months and the individual does not retain a right to re-employment under an applicable statute or by contract, the employment relationship is deemed </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-15 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">to terminate on the first date immediately following such six-month period. Notwithstanding the foregoing, where a leave of absence is due to any medically
determinable physical or mental impairment that can be expected to result in death or can be expected to last for a continuous period of not less than six months, where such impairment causes the Employee to be unable to perform the duties of his or
her position of employment or any substantially similar position of employment, a 29-month period of absence may be substituted for such six-month period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) If an Employee provides services both an as employee and as a member of the Board of Directors of the Company, the services provided as a Director are generally not taken into account in
determining whether the Employee has Separated from Service as an Employee for purposes of the Plan, in accordance with final regulations under Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(qq) <B><U>Service</U></B>: The period of a Participant&#146;s employment calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.2
for purposes of determining his entitlement to benefits under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(rr) <B><U>Single Life
Annuity</U></B>: A level monthly Annuity payable to a Participant for his life only, with no survivor benefits to his Eligible Spouse or any other person. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ss) <B><U>Single Lump Sum</U></B>: The distribution of a Participant&#146;s total 409A Pension in the form of a single payment, which payment shall be the Actuarial Equivalent of the
Participant&#146;s 409A Pension as of the Participant&#146;s Normal Retirement Date (or Late Retirement Date, if applicable), but not less than the Actuarial Equivalent of the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension as of the Participant&#146;s Early
Retirement Date, in the case of a Participant who is entitled to an immediate Early 409A Retirement Pension. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-16 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(tt) <B><U>Social Security Act</U></B>: The Social Security Act of the
United States, as amended, an enactment providing governmental benefits in connection with events such as old age, death and disability. Any reference herein to the Social Security Act (or any of the benefits provided thereunder) shall be taken as a
reference to any comparable governmental program of another country, as determined by the Plan Administrator, but only to the extent the Plan Administrator judges the computation of those benefits to be administratively feasible. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(uu) <B><U>Taxable Wage Base</U></B>: The contribution and benefit base (as determined under section 230 of the Social
Security Act) in effect for the Plan Year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(vv) <B><U>Vested Pension</U></B>: The Pension available to a
Participant under Section&nbsp;4.3. The term &#147;409A Vested Pension&#148; shall be used to refer to the portion of a Vested Pension that is derived from the 409A Program. The term &#147;Pre-409A Vested Pension&#148; shall be used to refer to the
portion of a Vested Pension that is derived from the Pre-409A Program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.2 <U>Construction</U>: The terms of the Plan
shall be construed in accordance with this section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Gender and Number</U>: The masculine gender,
where appearing in the Plan, shall be deemed to include the feminine gender, and the singular may include the plural, unless the context clearly indicates to the contrary. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;
</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-17 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Compounds of the Word &#147;Here&#148;</U>: The words
&#147;hereof&#148;, &#147;hereunder&#148; and other similar compounds of the word &#147;here&#148; shall mean and refer to the entire Plan, not to any particular provision or section. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Examples</U>: Whenever an example is provided or the text uses the term &#147;including&#148; followed by a
specific item or items, or there is a passage having a similar effect, such passages of the Plan shall be construed as if the phrase &#147;without limitation&#148; followed such example or term (or otherwise applied to such passage in a manner that
avoids limits on its breadth of application). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(d) <U>Subdivisions of the Plan Document</U>: This Plan
document is divided and subdivided using the following progression: articles, sections, subsections, paragraphs, subparagraphs, clauses, and sub-clauses. Articles are designated by capital roman numerals. Sections are designated by Arabic numerals
containing a decimal point. Subsections are designated by lower-case letters in parentheses. Paragraphs are designated by Arabic numerals in parentheses. Subparagraphs are designated by lower-case roman numerals in parentheses. Clauses are
designated by upper-case letters in parentheses. Sub-clauses are designated by upper-case roman numerals in parentheses. Any reference in a section to a subsection (with no accompanying section reference) shall be read as a reference to the
subsection with the specified designation contained in that same section. A similar rule shall apply with respect to paragraph references within a subsection and subparagraph references within a paragraph. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">II-18 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE III </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Participation and Service </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.1 <U>Participation</U>: An Employee shall be a
Participant in the Plan during the period: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) When he would be currently entitled to receive a Pension
under the Plan if his employment terminated at such time, or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) When he would be so entitled but for the
vesting requirement of Section&nbsp;4.7. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">It is expressly contemplated that an Employee, who is entitled to receive a Pension under the
Plan as of a particular time, may subsequently cease to be entitled to receive a Pension under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.2
<U>Service</U>: A Participant&#146;s entitlement to a Pension and to a Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension for his Eligible Spouse shall be determined under Article IV based upon his period of Service. A Participant&#146;s period of Service shall
be determined under Article III of the Salaried Plan. If a Participant&#146;s period of Service (as so determined) would extend beyond the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service date because of a leave of absence, the Plan Administrator may
provide for determining the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension at Separation from Service by projecting the benefit the Participant would have if all such Service were taken into account under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.3 <U>Credited Service</U>: The amount of a Participant&#146;s Pension and a Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension shall be based upon
the Participant&#146;s period of Credited Service, as determined under Article III of the Salaried Plan. If a Participant&#146;s period of Credited Service (as so determined) would extend beyond the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service date
because </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">III-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">of a leave of absence, the Plan Administrator may provide for determining the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension at Separation from Service by projecting the
benefit the Participant would have if all such Service were taken into account under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">III-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE IV </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Requirements for Benefits </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A Participant shall be eligible to receive a Pension and
a surviving Eligible Spouse shall be eligible for certain survivor benefits as provided in this Article. The amount of any such Pension or survivor benefit shall be determined in accordance with Article V. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.1 <U>Normal 409A Retirement Pension</U>: A Participant shall be eligible for a Normal 409A Retirement Pension if he Separates from
Service after attaining Normal Retirement Age. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.2 <U>Early 409A Retirement Pension</U>: A Participant shall be eligible
for an Early 409A Retirement Pension if he Separates from Service prior to attaining Normal Retirement Age but after attaining at least age 55 and completing 10 or more years of Elapsed Time Service. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.3 <U>409A Vested Pension</U>: A Participant who is vested under Section&nbsp;4.7 shall be eligible to receive a 409A Vested Pension if
he Separates from Service before he is eligible for a Normal 409A Retirement Pension or an Early 409A Retirement Pension. A Participant who terminates employment prior to satisfying the vesting requirement in Section&nbsp;4.7 shall not be eligible
to receive a Pension under this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.4 <U>Late 409A Retirement Pension</U>: A Participant who continues without a
Separation from Service after his Normal Retirement Age shall not receive a Pension until his Late Retirement Date. Thereafter, a Participant shall be eligible for a Late Retirement Pension determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.4 of the
Salaried Plan (but without regard to any requirement for notice of suspension under ERISA section 203(a)(3)(B) or any adjustment as under Section&nbsp;5.5(d) of the Salaried Plan). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IV-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.5 <U>409A Disability Pension</U>: A Participant shall be eligible for a 409A
Disability Pension if he meets the requirements for a Disability Pension under the Salaried Plan. A Participant&#146;s 409A Disability Pension, if any, shall generally be comprised of two parts. The first part shall represent the benefits with
respect to a disabled Participant&#146;s Credited Service through the day of the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service (<I>i.e.</I>, the Participant&#146;s &#147;Pre-Separation Accruals&#148;). In the event the disabled Participant continues to
receive Credited Service related to the disability after such Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Disability Pension shall have a second part, which shall represent all benefits accrued with respect to Credited Service from the date
immediately following the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service until the earliest of the Participant&#146;s (i)&nbsp;attainment of age 65, (ii)&nbsp;benefit commencement date under the Salaried Plan or (iii)&nbsp;recovery from the disability
(<I>i.e.</I>, the Participant&#146;s &#147;Post-LTD Accruals&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.6 <U>Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A
Pension</U>: A Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension is payable under this section only in the event the Participant dies prior to his Annuity Starting Date. Any Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension payable on behalf of a Participant shall
commence as of the first day of the month following the later of (i)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s death and, (ii)&nbsp;the date the Participant attains or would have attained age 55. Subject to Section&nbsp;4.9, any Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A
Pension shall continue monthly for the life of the Eligible Spouse. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Active, Disabled and Retired
Employees</U>: A Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension shall be payable under this subsection to a Participant&#146;s Eligible Spouse (if any) who is entitled under the Salaried Plan to the pre-retirement spouse&#146;s pension for survivors of
active, disabled and retired employees. The amount (if any) of such Pension shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of Section&nbsp;5.3 (with the 409A Pension, if any, determined after application of Section&nbsp;5.6). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IV-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Vested Employees</U>: A Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension
shall be payable under this subsection to a Participant&#146;s Eligible Spouse (if any) who is entitled under the Salaried Plan to the pre-retirement spouse&#146;s pension for survivors of vested terminated Employees. The amount (if any) of such
Pension shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of Section&nbsp;5.3 (with the 409A Pension, if any, determined after application of Section&nbsp;5.6). If pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.6(b) a Participant has Pre-Retirement
Spouse&#146;s coverage in effect for his Eligible Spouse, any Pension calculated for the Participant under Section&nbsp;5.2(b) shall be reduced for each year such coverage is in effect by the applicable percentage set forth below (based on the
Participant&#146;s age at the time the coverage is in effect) with a pro rata reduction for any portion of a year. No reduction shall be made for coverage in effect within the 90-day period following a Participant&#146;s termination of employment.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="68%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">.175</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">.3</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">.5</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">60 &#151; 64</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">.5</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">%</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.7 <U>Vesting</U>: A Participant shall be fully vested in, and have a
nonforfeitable right to, his Accrued Benefit at the time he becomes fully vested in his accrued benefit under the Salaried Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">4.8 <U>Time of Payment</U>: The distribution of a Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall commence as of the time specified in Section&nbsp;6.1, subject to Section&nbsp;6.6. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IV-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.9 <U>Cashout Distributions</U>: Notwithstanding the availability or applicability of a
different form of payment under Article VI, the following rules shall apply in the case of certain small benefit Annuity payments: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Distribution of Participant&#146;s Pension</U>: If at a Participant&#146;s Annuity Starting Date the Actuarial Equivalent lump sum value of the Participant&#146;s PEP Pension is equal to or less than $15,000,
the Plan Administrator shall distribute to the Participant such lump sum value of the Participant&#146;s PEP Pension. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Distribution of Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension Benefit</U>: If at the time payments are to commence to an Eligible Spouse under Section&nbsp;4.6, the Actuarial Equivalent lump sum value of the PEP
Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension to be paid is equal to or less than $15,000, the Plan Administrator shall distribute to the Eligible Spouse such lump sum value of the PEP Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Any lump sum distributed under this section shall be in lieu of the Pension that otherwise would be distributable to the Participant or Eligible Spouse
hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.10 <U>Reemployment of Certain Participants</U>: In the case of a current or former Participant who is
receiving his Pension as an Annuity under Section&nbsp;6.1(b), and who is reemployed and is eligible to re-participate in the Salaried Plan after his Annuity Starting Date, payment of his 409A Pension will continue to be paid in the same form as it
was paid prior to his reemployment. Any additional 409A Pension that is earned by the Participant shall be paid based on the Separation from Service that follows the Participant&#146;s re-employment. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.11 <U>Forfeiture of Benefits</U>: Effective beginning with benefits accrued after December&nbsp;31, 2008 (&#147;Post-2008
Accruals&#148;), and notwithstanding any other provision of this Plan to the contrary, if the Plan Administrator determines that a Participant has engaged in Prohibited </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IV-4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Misconduct at any time prior to the second anniversary of his or her Separation from Service, the Participant shall forfeit all Post-2008 Accruals (whether
paid previously, being paid currently or payable in the future), and his or her 409A Pension shall be adjusted to reflect such forfeiture and previously paid Post-2008 Accruals shall be recovered. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IV-5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE V </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Amount of Retirement Pension </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">When a 409A Pension becomes payable to or on behalf
of a Participant under this Plan, the amount of such 409A Pension shall be determined under Section&nbsp;5.1 or 5.3 (whichever is applicable), subject to any adjustments required under Sections&nbsp;4.6(b) and 5.4. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.1 <U>Participant&#146;s 409A Pension</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Calculating the 409A Pension</U>: A Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be calculated as follows (on the basis specified in subsection (b)&nbsp;below and using the definitions appearing
in subsection (c)&nbsp;below): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) His Total Pension, <U>reduced by</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) His Salaried Plan Pension, and then <U>further reduced by</U> (but not below zero) </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) His Pre-409A Pension. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Basis for Determining</U>: The 409A Pension Benefit amount in subsection (a)&nbsp;above shall be determined on a basis that takes into account applicable reductions for early commencement
and that reflects, as applicable, the relative value of forms of payment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Definitions</U>: The
following definitions apply for purposes of this section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) A Participant&#146;s &#147;Total
Pension&#148; means the greater of: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) The amount of the Participant&#146;s pension determined under the
terms of the Salaried Plan, but without regard to: (A)&nbsp;the limitations imposed by sections 401(a)(17) and 415 of the Code (as such </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">limitations are interpreted and applied under the Salaried Plan), and (B)&nbsp;the actuarial adjustment under Section&nbsp;5.7(d) of the Salaried Plan
(relating to benefits that are deferred beyond the Participant&#146;s Normal Retirement Date); or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii)
The amount (if any) of the Participant&#146;s PEP Guarantee determined under Section&nbsp;5.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">As necessary to ensure the
