Participant&#146;s receipt of a &#147;greater of&#148; benefit, the foregoing comparison shall be made by reflecting, as applicable, the relative value of forms of payment. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) A Participant&#146;s &#147;Salaried Plan Pension&#148; means the amount of the Participant&#146;s pension determined
under the terms of the Salaried Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) A Participant&#146;s &#147;Pre-409A Pension&#148; means the
amount of the Participant&#146;s pension determined under Section&nbsp;5.6. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.2 <U>PEP Guarantee</U>: A Participant who
is eligible under subsection (a)&nbsp;below shall be entitled to a PEP Guarantee benefit determined under subsection (b)&nbsp;below. In the case of other Participants, the PEP Guarantee shall not apply. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Eligibility</U>: A Participant shall be covered by this section if the Participant has 1988 pensionable earnings
from an Employer of at least $75,000. For purposes of this section, &#147;1988 pensionable earnings&#148; means the Participant&#146;s remuneration for the 1988 calendar year, within the meaning of the Salaried Plan as in effect in 1988. &#147;1988
pensionable earnings&#148; does not include remuneration from an entity attributable to any period when that entity was not an Employer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>PEP Guarantee Formula</U>: The amount of a Participant&#146;s PEP
Guarantee shall be determined under the applicable formula in paragraph (1), subject to the special rules in paragraph (2). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Formulas</U>: The amount of a Participant&#146;s Pension under this paragraph shall be determined in accordance with subparagraph (i)&nbsp;below. However, if the Participant was actively employed by the PepsiCo
Organization in a classification eligible for the Salaried Plan prior to July&nbsp;1, 1975, the amount of his Pension under this paragraph shall be the greater of the amounts determined under subparagraphs (i)&nbsp;and (ii), provided that
subparagraph (ii)(B) shall not apply in determining the amount of a Vested Pension. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>Formula A</U>:
The Pension amount under this subparagraph shall be: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(A) 3 percent of the Participant&#146;s Highest
Average Monthly Earnings for the first 10 years of Credited Service, <U>plus</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(B) 1 percent of the
Participant&#146;s Highest Average Monthly Earnings for each year of Credited Service in excess of 10 years, <U>less</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(C) 1-2/3 percent of the Participant&#146;s Primary Social Security Amount multiplied by years of Credited Service not in excess of 30 years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In determining the amount of a Vested Pension under this Formula&nbsp;A, the Pension shall first be calculated on the basis of (I)&nbsp;the Credited Service the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Participant would have earned had he remained in the employ of the Employer until his Normal Retirement Age, and (II) his Highest Average Monthly Earnings
and Primary Social Security Amount at his Separation from Service, and then shall be reduced by multiplying the resulting amount by a fraction, the numerator of which is the Participant&#146;s actual years of Credited Service on his Separation from
Service and the denominator of which is the years of Credited Service he would have earned had he remained in the employ of an Employer until his Normal Retirement Age. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <U>Formula B</U>: The Pension amount under this subparagraph shall be the greater of (A)&nbsp;or (B)&nbsp;below:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(A) 1-1/2 percent of Highest Average Monthly Earnings times the number of years of Credited Service, less
50 percent of the Participant&#146;s Primary Social Security Amount, or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(B) 3 percent of Highest Average
Monthly Earnings times the number of years of Credited Service up to 15 years, less 50 percent of the Participant&#146;s Primary Social Security Amount. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In determining the amount of a Disability Pension under Formula A or B above, the Pension shall be calculated on the basis of the Participant&#146;s Credited Service (determined in accordance with
Section&nbsp;3.3(d)(3) of the Salaried Plan), and his Highest Average Monthly Earnings and Primary Social Security Amount at the date of disability. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Calculation</U>: The amount of the PEP Guarantee shall be
determined pursuant to paragraph (1)&nbsp;above, subject to the following special rules: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>Surviving
Eligible Spouse&#146;s Annuity</U>: Subject to subparagraph (iii)&nbsp;below and the last sentence of this subparagraph, if the Participant has an Eligible Spouse, the Participant&#146;s Eligible Spouse shall be entitled to receive a survivor
annuity equal to 50 percent of the Participant&#146;s Annuity under this section, with no corresponding reduction in such Annuity for the Participant. Annuity payments to a surviving Eligible Spouse shall begin on the first day of the month
coincident with or following the Participant&#146;s death and shall end with the last monthly payment due prior to the Eligible Spouse&#146;s death. If the Eligible Spouse is more than 10 years younger than the Participant, the survivor benefit
payable under this subparagraph shall be adjusted as provided below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(A) For each full year more than 10
but less than 21 that the surviving Eligible Spouse is younger than the Participant, the survivor benefit payable to such spouse shall be reduced by 0.8 percent. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(B) For each full year more than 20 that the surviving Eligible Spouse is younger than the Participant, the survivor
benefit payable to such spouse shall be reduced by an additional 0.4 percent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <U>Reductions</U>: The
following reductions shall apply in determining a Participant&#146;s PEP Guarantee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(A) If the Participant will receive an Early Retirement Pension, the
payment amount shall be reduced by 3/12ths of 1 percent for each month by which the benefit commencement date precedes the date the Participant would attain his Normal Retirement Date. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(B) If the Participant is entitled to a Vested Pension, the payment amount shall be reduced to the actuarial equivalent
of the amount payable at his Normal Retirement Date (if payment commences before such date), and the Section&nbsp;4.6(b) reductions for any Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s coverage shall apply. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(C) This clause applies if the Participant will receive his Pension in a form that provides an Eligible Spouse benefit,
continuing for the life of the surviving spouse, that is greater than that provided under subparagraph (i). In this instance, the Participant&#146;s Pension under this section shall be reduced so that the total value of the benefit payable on the
Participant&#146;s behalf is the actuarial equivalent of the Pension otherwise payable under the foregoing provisions of this section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(D) This clause applies if the Participant will receive his Pension in a form that provides a survivor annuity for a beneficiary who is not his Eligible Spouse. In this instance, the Participant&#146;s Pension under
this section shall be reduced so that the total value of the benefit payable on the Participant&#146;s behalf is the actuarial equivalent of a Single Life Annuity for the Participant&#146;s life. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(E) This clause applies if the Participant will receive his Pension in
a Annuity form that includes inflation protection described in Section&nbsp;6.2(b). In this instance, the Participant&#146;s Pension under this section shall be reduced so that the total value of the benefit payable on the Participant&#146;s behalf
is the actuarial equivalent of the elected Annuity without such protection. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iii) <U>Lump Sum
Conversion</U>: The amount of the Retirement Pension determined under this section for a Participant whose Retirement Pension will be distributed in the form of a lump sum shall be the actuarial equivalent of the Participant&#146;s PEP Guarantee
determined under this section, taking into account the value of any survivor benefit under subparagraph (i)&nbsp;above and any early retirement reductions under subparagraph (ii)(A) above. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For purposes of this paragraph (2), actuarial equivalence shall be determined taking into account the PEP Guarantee&#146;s purpose to
preserve substantially the value of a benefit under the pre-1989 terms of the Plan and the 409A Plan&#146;s design that offers alternative annuities that are considered actuarial equivalent for purposes of Section&nbsp;409A (taking into account,
without limitation, the special rule for subsidized joint and survivor annuities in Treasury Regulation &#167; 1.409A-3(b)(ii)(C)). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.3 <U>Amount of Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension</U>: The monthly amount of
the Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension payable to a surviving Eligible Spouse under Section&nbsp;4.6 shall be determined under subsection (a)&nbsp;below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Calculation</U>: An Eligible Spouse&#146;s Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension shall be equal to: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) The Eligible Spouse&#146;s Total Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension, <U>reduced by</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) The Eligible Spouse&#146;s Salaried Plan Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension, and then <U>further reduced by</U>
(but not below zero) </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) The Eligible Spouse&#146;s Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension derived from the
Pre-409A Program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Definitions</U>: The following definitions apply for purposes of this section.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) An Eligible Spouse&#146;s &#147;Total Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension&#148; means the greater
of: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) The amount of the Eligible Spouse&#146;s pre-retirement spouse&#146;s pension determined under
the terms of the Salaried Plan, but without regard to: (A)&nbsp;the limitations imposed by sections 401(a)(17) and 415 of the Code (as such limitations are interpreted and applied under the Salaried Plan), and (B)&nbsp;the actuarial adjustment under
Section&nbsp;5.5(d) of the Salaried Plan; or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) The amount (if any) of the Eligible Spouse&#146;s PEP
Guarantee Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension determined under subsection (c). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In making this comparison, the benefits in subparagraphs (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;above
shall be calculated as if payable as of what would be the Normal Retirement Date of the Participant related to the Eligible Spouse. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) An &#147;Eligible Spouse&#146;s Salaried Plan Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension&#148; means the Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension that would be payable to the Eligible Spouse under the terms of the Salaried
Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) An &#147;Eligible Spouse&#146;s Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension derived from the Pre-409A
Program&#148; means the Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension that would be payable to the Eligible Spouse under the terms of the Pre-409A Program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>PEP Guarantee Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension</U>: An Eligible Spouse&#146;s PEP Guarantee Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension shall be determined in accordance with paragraph
(1)&nbsp;or (2)&nbsp;below, whichever is applicable, with reference to the PEP Guarantee (if any) that would have been available to the Participant under Section&nbsp;5.2. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Normal Rule</U>: The Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension payable under this paragraph shall be equal to the
amount that would be payable as a survivor annuity, under a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity, if the Participant had: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) Separated from Service on the date of death (or, if earlier, his actual Separation from Service); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) Commenced a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity on the same date payments of the Qualified Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension are to commence; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iii) Died on the day immediately following such commencement.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Special Rule for Active and Disabled Employees</U>: Notwithstanding paragraph (1)&nbsp;above, the
Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension paid on behalf of a Participant described in Section&nbsp;4.6(a) shall not be less than an amount equal to 25 percent of such Participant&#146;s PEP Guarantee determined under Section&nbsp;5.2. For this purpose,
Credited Service shall be determined as provided in Section&nbsp;3.3(d)(2) of the Salaried Plan, and the deceased Participant&#146;s Highest Average Monthly Earnings, Primary Social Security Amount and Covered Compensation shall be determined as of
his date of death. A Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension under this paragraph is not reduced for early commencement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Principles similar
to those applicable under &#150; (i)&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5.1(b), and (ii)&nbsp;the last sentence of Section&nbsp;5.2(b)(2) shall apply in determining the Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s 409A Pension under this section. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.4 <U>Certain Adjustments</U>: Pensions determined under the foregoing sections of this Article are subject to adjustment as provided
in this section. For purposes of this section, &#147;specified plan&#148; shall mean the Salaried Plan or a nonqualified pension plan similar to this Plan. A nonqualified pension plan is similar to this Plan if it is sponsored by a member of the
PepsiCo Organization and if its benefits are not based on participant pay deferrals. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Adjustments
for Rehired Participants</U>: This subsection shall apply to a current or former Participant who is reemployed after his Annuity Starting Date and </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">whose benefit under the Salaried Plan is recalculated based on an additional period of Credited Service. In the event of any such recalculation, the
Participant&#146;s PEP Pension shall also be recalculated hereunder to the maximum extent permissible under Section&nbsp;409A. For this purpose and to the maximum extent permissible under Section&nbsp;409A, the PEP Guarantee under Section&nbsp;5.2
is adjusted for in-service distributions and prior distributions in the same manner as benefits are adjusted under the Salaried Plan, but by taking into account benefits under this Plan and any specified plans. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Adjustment for Increased Pension Under Other Plans</U>: If the benefit paid under a specified plan on behalf of a
Participant is increased after PEP benefits on his behalf have been determined (whether the increase is by order of a court, by agreement of the plan administrator of the specified plan, or otherwise), then the PEP benefit for the Participant shall
be recalculated to the maximum extent permissible under Section&nbsp;409A. If the recalculation identifies an overpayment hereunder, the Plan Administrator shall take such steps as it deems advisable to recover the overpayment. It is specifically
intended that there shall be no duplication of payments under this Plan and any specified plans to the maximum extent permissible under Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.5 <U>Excludable Employment</U>: An executive who has signed a written agreement with the Company pursuant to which the individual either (i)&nbsp;waives eligibility under the Plan (even if the
individual otherwise meets the definition of Employee under the Plan), or (ii)&nbsp;agrees not to participate in the Plan, shall not thereafter become entitled to a benefit or to any increase in benefits in connection with such employment (whichever
applies). Written agreements may be entered into either before or after the executive becomes eligible for or begins participation in the Plan, and such written agreement may take any form that is deemed effective by the Company. This
Section&nbsp;5.5 shall apply with respect to agreements that are entered into on or after January&nbsp;1, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.6 <U>Pre-409A Pension</U>: A Participant&#146;s Pre-409A Pension is the portion of the
Participant&#146;s Pension that is grandfathered under Treasury Regulation &#167; 1.409A-6(a)(3)(i) and (iv). Principles similar to those applicable under &#150; (i)&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5.1(b), and (ii)&nbsp;the last sentence of Section&nbsp;5.2(b)(2)
shall apply in determining the Pre-409A Pension under this section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.7 <U>Offset</U>: Notwithstanding any other
provision of the Plan, the Company may reduce the amount of any payment or benefit that is or would be payable to or on behalf of a Participant by the amount of any obligation of the Participant to the Company that is or becomes due and payable,
provided that (1)&nbsp;the obligation of the Participant to the Company was incurred during the employment relationship, (2)&nbsp;the reduction during any Plan Year may not exceed the amount allowed under Code Section&nbsp;409A and (3)&nbsp;the
reduction is made at the same time and in the same amount as the obligation otherwise would have been due and collectable from the Participant. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">V-12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE VI </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Distribution of Benefits </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The terms of this Article govern (i)&nbsp;the
distribution of benefits to a Participant who becomes entitled to a 409A Pension, and (ii)&nbsp;the continuation of benefits (if any) to such Participant&#146;s beneficiary following the Participant&#146;s death. A Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s
Pension derived from the 409A Program shall be payable as an Annuity for the life of the Eligible Spouse in all cases, subject to Section&nbsp;4.9 (cashout distributions). The distribution of a Pre-409A Pension is governed by the terms of the
Pre-409A Program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.1 <U>Form and Timing of Distributions</U>: Benefits under the 409A Program shall be distributed as
follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>409A Retirement Pension</U>: The following rules govern the distribution of a
Participant&#146;s 409A Retirement Pension: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Generally</U>: A Participant&#146;s 409A Retirement
Pension shall be distributed as a Single Lump Sum on the first day of the month that is coincident with or next follows the Participant&#146;s Retirement Date, subject to paragraph (2)&nbsp;and Section&nbsp;6.6 (delay for Key Employees). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Prior Payment Election</U>: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), a Participant who is entitled to a 409A Retirement
Pension and who made an election (i)&nbsp;up to and including December&nbsp;31, 2007, and (ii)&nbsp;at least six months prior to and in a calendar year prior to the Participant&#146;s Annuity Starting Date shall receive his benefit in accordance
with such payment election. A payment election allowed a Participant to choose either (i)&nbsp;to receive a distribution of his benefit in an Annuity form, (ii)&nbsp;to commence distribution of his benefit at a time </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">other than as provided in paragraph 6.1(a)(1), or both (i)&nbsp;and (ii). A payment election made by a Participant who is only eligible to receive a Vested
Pension on his Separation from Service shall be disregarded. Subject to Section&nbsp;4.9 (cashouts), a Participant who has validly elected to receive an Annuity shall receive his benefit as a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity if he is married or
as a Single Life Annuity if he is unmarried, unless he elects one of the optional forms of payment described in Section&nbsp;6.2 in accordance with the election procedures in Section&nbsp;6.3(a). A Participant shall be considered married if he is
married on his Annuity Starting Date (with such Annuity Starting Date determined taking into account any election applicable under this subsection). To the extent a Participant&#146;s benefit commences later than it would under paragraph 6.1(a)(1)
as a result of an election under this paragraph 6.1(a)(2), the Participant&#146;s benefit will be paid with interest equal to that specified in Section&nbsp;2.1(b)(3), which interest shall be paid at the time elected by the Participant under this
paragraph 6.1(a)(2). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>409A Vested Pension</U>: Subject to Sections 4.9, Section&nbsp;6.6 and
subsection (c)&nbsp;below, a Participant&#146;s 409A Vested Pension shall be distributed in accordance with paragraph (1)&nbsp;or (2)&nbsp;below, unless, in the case of a married Participant (as determined under the standards in paragraph 6.1(a)(2),
above), he elects one of the optional forms of payment distributions in Section&nbsp;6.2 in accordance with the election procedures in Section&nbsp;6.3(a): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Separation Prior to Age 55</U>: In the case of a Participant who Separates from Service with at least five years of Service prior to attaining </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">age 55, the Participant&#146;s 409A Vested Pension shall be distributed as an Annuity commencing on the first of the month that is coincident with or
immediately follows the date he attains age 55, which shall be the Annuity Starting Date of his 409A Vested Pension. A distribution under this subsection shall be in the form of a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity if the Participant is married,
or as a Single Life Annuity if he is not married. A Participant shall be considered married for purposes of this paragraph if he is married on the Annuity Starting Date of his 409A Vested Pension. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Separation at Ages 55 Through 64</U>: In the case of a Participant who Separates from Service with at least five
years but less than ten years of Service and on or after attaining age 55 but prior to attaining age 65, the Participant&#146;s 409A Vested Pension shall be distributed as an Annuity (as provided in paragraph (1)&nbsp;above) commencing on the first
of the month that follows his Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Disability Pension</U>: The portion of a
Participant&#146;s 409A Disability Pension representing Pre-Separation Accruals shall be paid on the first day of the month following the later of (i)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55 and (ii)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s Separation
from Service. The available forms of payment for the portion of a Participant&#146;s 409A Disability Pension representing Pre-Separation Accruals shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in
Section&nbsp;6.2, below (including the different forms available to a married versus an unmarried Participant). The portion of a Participant&#146;s 409A Disability Pension representing Post-LTD Accruals shall be paid on the first day of the month
following the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 65 in a lump sum. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.2 <U>Available Forms of Payment</U>: This section sets forth the payment options
available to a Participant who is entitled to a Retirement Pension under paragraph 6.1(a)(2) above or a Vested Pension under subsection 6.1(b) above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Basic Forms</U>: A Participant who is entitled to a Retirement Pension may choose one of the following optional forms of payment by making a valid election in accordance with the election
procedures in Section&nbsp;6.3(a). A Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension and who is married on his Annuity Starting Date may choose one of the optional forms of payment available under paragraphs (1), 2(ii) or 2(iii) below with his
Eligible Spouse as his beneficiary (and no other optional form of payment available under this subsection (a)&nbsp;shall be permitted to such a Participant). A Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension and who is not married on his Annuity
Starting Date shall receive a Single Life Annuity. Each optional annuity is the actuarial equivalent of the Single Life Annuity: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Single Life Annuity Option</U>: A Participant may receive his 409A Pension in the form of a Single Life Annuity, which provides monthly payments ending with the last payment due prior to his death. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Survivor Options</U>: A Participant may receive his 409A Pension in accordance with one of the following
survivor options: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>100 Percent Survivor Option</U>: The Participant shall receive a reduced 409A
Pension payable for life, ending with the last monthly payment due prior to his death. Payments in the same reduced </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">amount shall continue after the Participant&#146;s death to his beneficiary for life, beginning on the first day of the month coincident with or following
the Participant&#146;s death and ending with the last monthly payment due prior to the beneficiary&#146;s death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">(ii) <U>75 Percent Survivor Option</U>: The Participant shall receive a reduced 409A Pension payable for life, ending with the last monthly payment due prior to his death. Payments in the amount of 75 percent of such reduced 409A Pension
shall be continued after the Participant&#146;s death to his beneficiary for life, beginning on the first day of the month coincident with or following the Participant&#146;s death and ending with the last monthly payment due prior to the
beneficiary&#146;s death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iii) <U>50 Percent Survivor Option</U>: The Participant shall receive a
reduced 409A Pension payable for life, ending with the last monthly payment due prior to his death. Payments in the amount of 50 percent of such reduced 409A Pension shall be continued after the Participant&#146;s death to his beneficiary for life,
beginning on the first day of the month coincident with or following the Participant&#146;s death and ending with the last monthly payment due prior to the beneficiary&#146;s death. A 50 percent survivor option under this paragraph shall be a
Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity if the Participant&#146;s beneficiary is his Eligible Spouse. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iv)
<U>Ten Years Certain and Life Option</U>: The Participant shall receive a reduced 409A Pension which shall be payable monthly for his lifetime but for not less than 120 months. If the retired Participant dies </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:15%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">before 120 payments have been made, the monthly 409A Pension amount shall be paid for the remainder of the 120 month period to the Participant&#146;s primary
beneficiary (or if the primary beneficiary has predeceased the Participant, the Participant&#146;s contingent beneficiary). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Inflation Protection</U>: The following levels of inflation protection may be provided to any Participant who elects to receive all or a part of his 409A Retirement Pension as an Annuity: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>5 Percent Inflation Protection</U>: A Participant&#146;s monthly benefit shall be initially reduced, but
thereafter shall be increased if inflation in the prior year exceeds 5 percent. The amount of the increase shall be the difference between inflation in the prior year and 5 percent. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>7 Percent Inflation Protection</U>: A Participant&#146;s monthly benefit shall be initially reduced, but
thereafter shall be increased if inflation in the prior year exceeds 7 percent. The amount of the increase shall be the difference between inflation in the prior year and 7 percent. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Benefits shall be subject to increase in accordance with this subsection each January&nbsp;1, beginning with the second January&nbsp;1
following the Participant&#146;s Annuity Starting Date. The amount of inflation in the prior year shall be determined based on inflation in the 12-month period ending on September&nbsp;30 of such year, with inflation measured in the same manner as
applies on the Effective Date for adjusting Social Security benefits for changes in the cost of living. Inflation protection that is in effect shall carry over to any survivor benefit payable on behalf of a Participant, and shall increase the
otherwise applicable survivor benefit as provided above. Any election by a Participant to receive inflation protection shall be irrevocable by such Participant or his surviving beneficiary. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.3 <U>Procedures for Elections</U>: This section sets forth the procedures for making
Annuity Starting Date elections (<I>i.e.</I>, elections under Section&nbsp;6.2). Subsection (a)&nbsp;sets forth the procedures for making a valid election of an optional form of payment under Section&nbsp;6.2 and subsection (b)&nbsp;includes special
rules for Participants with multiple Annuity Starting Dates. An election under this Article VI shall be treated as received on a particular day if it is: (i)&nbsp;postmarked that day, or (ii)&nbsp;actually received by the Plan Administrator on that
day. Receipt under (ii)&nbsp;must occur by the close of business on the date in question, which time is to be determined by the Plan Administrator. Spousal consent is not required for an election to be valid. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Election of an Optional Form of Payment</U>: To be valid, an election of an optional form of Annuity under
Section&nbsp;6.2, for (i)&nbsp;a Participant&#146;s 409A Retirement Pension (if a proper election was made under paragraph 6.1(a)(2)) or (ii)&nbsp;a Participant&#146;s 409A Vested Terminated Pension, must be in writing, signed by the Participant,
and received by the Plan Administrator at least one day prior to the Annuity Starting Date that applies to the Participant&#146;s Pension in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.1. In addition, an election under this subsection must specify one of the
optional forms of payment available under Section&nbsp;6.2 and a beneficiary, if applicable, in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.5 below. To the extent permitted by the Plan Administrator, an election made through electronic media shall be considered
to satisfy the requirement for a written election, and an electronic affirmation of such an election shall be considered to satisfy the requirement for a signed election. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;
</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Multiple Annuity Starting Dates</U>: When amounts become payable
to a Participant in accordance with Article IV, they shall be payable as of the Participant&#146;s Annuity Starting Date and the election procedures (in this section and Sections 6.1 and 6.5) shall apply to all of the Participant&#146;s unpaid
accruals as of such Annuity Starting Date, with the following exception. In the case of a Participant who is rehired after his initial Annuity Starting Date and who (i)&nbsp;is currently receiving an Annuity that remained in pay status upon rehire,
or (ii)&nbsp;was previously paid a lump sum distribution (other than a cashout distribution described in Section&nbsp;4.9(a)), the Participant&#146;s subsequent Annuity Starting Date (as a result of his subsequent Separation from Service), and the
election procedures at such subsequent Annuity Starting Date, shall apply only to the portion of his benefit that accrues after his rehire. Any prior accruals that remain to be paid as of the Participant&#146;s subsequent Annuity Starting Date shall
continue to be payable in accordance with the elections made at his initial Annuity Starting Date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.4 <U>Special Rules
for Survivor Options</U>: The following special rules shall apply for the survivor options available under Section&nbsp;6.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Effect of Certain Deaths</U>: If a Participant makes an election under Section&nbsp;6.3(a) to receive his 409A Retirement Pension in the form of an optional Annuity that includes a benefit for a surviving
beneficiary under Section&nbsp;6.2 and the Participant or his beneficiary (beneficiaries in the case of the optional form of payment in Section&nbsp;6.2(a)(2)(iv)) dies prior to the Annuity Starting Date of such Annuity, the election shall be
disregarded. If the Participant dies after this Annuity Starting Date but before his 409A Retirement Pension actually commences, the election shall be given effect and the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">amount payable to his surviving Eligible Spouse or other beneficiary shall commence on the first day of the month following his death (any back payments due
the Participant shall be payable to his estate). In the case of a Participant who has elected the form of payment described in Section&nbsp;6.2(a)(2)(iv), if such Participant: (i)&nbsp;dies after his Annuity Starting Date, (ii)&nbsp;without a
surviving primary or contingent beneficiary, and (iii)&nbsp;before receiving 120 payments under the form of payment, then the remaining payments due under such form of payment shall be paid to the Participant&#146;s estate. If payments have
commenced under such form of payment to a Participant&#146;s primary or contingent beneficiary and such beneficiary dies before payments are completed, then the remaining payments due under such form of payment shall be paid to such
beneficiary&#146;s estate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Non-Spouse Beneficiaries</U>: If a Participant&#146;s beneficiary is not
his Eligible Spouse, he may not elect: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) The 100 percent survivor option described in
Section&nbsp;6.2(a)(2)(i) if his non-spouse beneficiary is more than 10 years younger than he is, or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2)
The 75 percent survivor option described in Section&nbsp;6.2(a)(2)(ii) if his non-spouse beneficiary is more than 19 years younger than he is. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.5 <U>Designation of Beneficiary</U>: A Participant who has elected under Section&nbsp;6.2 to receive all or part of his Retirement Pension in a form of payment that includes a survivor option shall designate a
beneficiary who will be entitled to any amounts payable on his death. Such designation shall be made on the election form used to choose such optional form of payment or an approved election form filed under the Salaried Plan, whichever is
applicable. In </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">the case of the survivor option described in Section&nbsp;6.2(a)(2)(iv), the Participant shall be entitled to name both a primary beneficiary and a
contingent beneficiary. A Participant (whether active or former) shall have the right to change or revoke his beneficiary designation at any time prior to his Annuity Starting Date. The designation of any beneficiary, and any change or revocation
thereof, shall be made in accordance with rules adopted by the Plan Administrator. A beneficiary designation shall not be effective unless and until filed with the Plan Administrator. If no beneficiary is properly designated and a Participant&#146;s
elects a survivor&#146;s option described in Section&nbsp;6.2(a)(2), the Participant&#146;s beneficiary shall be his Eligible Spouse. A Participant entitled to a Vested Pension does not have the right or ability to name a beneficiary; if the
Participant is permitted under Section&nbsp;6.2 to elect an optional form of payment, then his beneficiary shall be his Eligible Spouse on his Annuity Starting Date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.6 <U>Required Delay for Key Employees</U>: Notwithstanding Section&nbsp;6.1 above, if a Participant is classified as a Key Employee upon his Separation from Service (or at such other time for
determining Key Employee status as may apply under Section&nbsp;409A), then distributions to the Participant shall commence as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Distribution of a Retirement Pension</U>: In the case of a Key Employee Participant who is entitled to a 409A Retirement Pension, distributions shall commence on the earliest first of the month that is at least
six months after the date the Participant Separates from Service (or, if earlier, the Participant&#146;s death). For periods before 2009, commencement of distributions, however, shall not be delayed under the preceding sentence if the
Participant&#146;s 409A Retirement Pension commences at the same time as his pension under the Salaried Plan in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.1(b)(3)(i). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Distribution of a Vested Pension</U>. In the case of a
Participant who is entitled to a 409A Vested Pension, distributions shall commence as provided in Section&nbsp;6.1(b), or if later, on the earliest first of the month that is at least six months after the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service
(or, if earlier, the Participant&#146;s death). For periods before 2009, commencement of distributions, however, shall not be delayed under the preceding sentence if the Participant&#146;s 409A Vested Pension commences at the same time as his
pension under the Salaried Plan in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.1(b)(3)(i). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Interest Paid for
Delay</U>. Any payments to the Participant that are delayed in accordance with the provisions of this Section&nbsp;6.6 shall be accumulated and paid as a lump sum payment, with interest equal to that specified in Section&nbsp;2.1(b)(3), on the date
payment occurs in accordance with subsection (a)&nbsp;or (b)&nbsp;above, whichever is applicable. If a Participant&#146;s beneficiary or estate is paid under subsection (a)&nbsp;or (b)&nbsp;above as a result of his death, then any payments that
would have been made to the Participant and that were delayed in accordance with the provisions of this Section&nbsp;6.6 shall be paid as otherwise provided in the Plan, with interest equal to that specified in Section&nbsp;2.1(b)(3). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6.7 <U>Payment of FICA and Related Income Taxes</U>: As provided in subsections (a)&nbsp;through (c)&nbsp;below, a portion of a
Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid as a single lump sum and remitted directly to the Internal Revenue Service (&#147;IRS&#148;) in satisfaction of the Participant&#146;s FICA Amount and the related withholding of income tax at source on
wages (imposed under Code Section&nbsp;3401 or the corresponding withholding provisions of the applicable state, local or foreign tax laws as a result of the payment of the FICA Amount) and the additional withholding of income tax at source on wages
that is attributable to the pyramiding of wages and taxes. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Timing of Payment:</U> As of the date that the Participant&#146;s
FICA Amount and related income tax withholding are due to be deposited with the IRS, a lump sum payment equal to the Participant&#146;s FICA Amount and any related income tax withholding shall be paid from the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension and
remitted to the IRS (or other applicable tax authority) in satisfaction of such FICA Amount and income tax withholding related to such FICA Amount. The classification of a Participant as a Key Employee (as defined in Section&nbsp;2.1(t)) shall have
no effect on the timing of the lump sum payment under this subsection (a). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Reduction of 409A
Pension</U>. To reflect the payment of a Participant&#146;s FICA Amount and any related income tax liability, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be reduced, effective as of the date for payment of the lump sum in accordance with subsection
(a)&nbsp;above, with such reduction being the Actuarial Equivalent of the lump sum payment used to satisfy the Participant&#146;s FICA Amount and related income tax withholding. It is expressly contemplated that this reduction may occur effective as
of a date that is after the date payment of a Participant&#146;s 409A Pension commences. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(A) <U>No Effect
on Commencement of 409A Pension</U>. The Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall commence in accordance with the terms of this Plan. The lump sum payment to satisfy the Participant&#146;s FICA Amount and related income tax withholding shall not affect
the time of payment of the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:21%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Participant&#146;s actuarially reduced 409A Pension, including not affecting any required delay in payment to a Participant who is classified as a Key
Employee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VI-13 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE VII </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Administration </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">7.1 <U>Authority to Administer Plan</U>: The Plan shall be
administered by the Plan Administrator, which shall have the authority to interpret the Plan and issue such regulations as it deems appropriate. The Plan Administrator shall maintain Plan records and make benefit calculations, and may rely upon
information furnished it by the Participant in writing, including the Participant&#146;s current mailing address, age and marital status. The Plan Administrator&#146;s interpretations, determinations, regulations and calculations shall be final and
binding on all persons and parties concerned. The Company, in its capacity as Plan Administrator or in any other capacity, shall not be a fiduciary of the Plan and any restrictions that apply to a party in interest under section 406 of ERISA shall
not apply to the Company or otherwise under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">7.2 <U>Facility of Payment</U>: Whenever, in the Plan
Administrator&#146;s opinion, a person entitled to receive any payment of a benefit or installment thereof hereunder is under a legal disability or is incapacitated in any way so as to be unable to manage his financial affairs, the Plan
Administrator may make payments to such person or to the legal representative of such person for his benefit, or the Plan Administrator may apply the payment for the benefit of such person in such manner as it considers advisable. Any payment of a
benefit or installment thereof in accordance with the provisions of this section shall be a complete discharge of any liability for the making of such payment under the provisions of the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">7.3 <U>Claims Procedure</U>: The Plan Administrator shall have the exclusive discretionary authority to construe and to interpret the
Plan, to decide all questions of eligibility for benefits and to determine the amount of such benefits, and its decisions on such matters are final and conclusive. As a result, benefits under this Plan will be paid only if the Plan </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VII-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Administrator decides in its discretion that the person claiming such benefits is entitled to them. This discretionary authority is intended to be absolute,
and in any case where the extent of this discretion is in question, the Plan Administrator is to be accorded the maximum discretion possible. Any exercise of this discretionary authority shall be reviewed by a court, arbitrator or other tribunal
under the arbitrary and capricious standard (<U>i.e.</U>, the abuse of discretion standard). If, pursuant to this discretionary authority, an assertion of any right to a benefit by or on behalf of a Participant or beneficiary (a
&#147;claimant&#148;) is wholly or partially denied, the Plan Administrator, or a party designated by the Plan Administrator, will provide such claimant within the 90-day period following the receipt of the claim by the Plan Administrator, a
comprehensible written notice setting forth: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) The specific reason or reasons for such denial;
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) Specific reference to pertinent Plan provisions on which the denial is based; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) A description of any additional material or information necessary for the claimant to submit to perfect the claim and
an explanation of why such material or information is necessary; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(d) A description of the Plan&#146;s
claim review procedure (including the time limits applicable to such process and a statement of the claimant&#146;s right to bring a civil action under ERISA following a further denial on review). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If the Plan Administrator determines that special circumstances require an extension of time for processing the claim it may extend the response period
from 90 to 180 days. If this occurs, the Plan Administrator will notify the claimant before the end of the initial 90-day period, indicating the special circumstances requiring the extension and the date by which the Plan Committee </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VII-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">expects to make the final decision. The claim review procedure is available upon written request by the claimant to the Plan Administrator, or the designated
party, within 60 days after receipt by the claimant of written notice of the denial of the claim. Upon review, the Plan Administrator shall provide the claimant a full and fair review of the claim, including the opportunity to submit to the Plan
Administrator comments, document, records and other information relevant to the claim and the Plan Administrator&#146;s review shall take into account such comments, documents, records and information regardless of whether it was submitted or
considered at the initial determination. The decision on review will be made within 60 days after receipt of the request for review, unless circumstances warrant an extension of time not to exceed an additional 60 days. If this occurs, notice of the
extension will be furnished to the claimant before the end of the initial 60-day period, indicating the special circumstances requiring the extension and the date by which the Plan Administrator expects to make the final decision. The final decision
shall be in writing and drafted in a manner calculated to be understood by the claimant; include specific reasons for the decision with references to the specific Plan provisions on which the decision is based; and provide that the claimant is
entitled to receive, upon request ad free of charge, reasonable access to, and copies of, all documents, records, and other information relevant to his or her claim for benefits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Any claim under the Plan that is reviewed by a court, arbitrator or any other tribunal shall be reviewed solely on the basis of the record before the Plan Administrator at the time it made its
determination. In addition, any such review shall be conditioned on the claimant&#146;s having fully exhausted all rights under this section. Any notice or other notification that is required to be sent to a claimant under this section may be sent
pursuant to any method approved under Department of Labor Regulation Section&nbsp;2520.104b-1 or other applicable guidance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VII-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">7.4 <U>Effect of Specific References</U>: Specific references in the Plan to the Plan
Administrator&#146;s discretion shall create no inference that the Plan Administrator&#146;s discretion in any other respect, or in connection with any other provision, is less complete or broad. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VII-4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE VIII </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Miscellaneous </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.1 <U>Nonguarantee of Employment</U>: Nothing contained in this
Plan shall be construed as a contract of employment between an Employer and any Employee, or as a right of any Employee to be continued in the employment of an Employer, or as a limitation of the right of an Employer to discharge any of its
Employees, with or without cause. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.2 <U>Nonalienation of Benefits</U>: Benefits payable under the Plan or the right to
receive future benefits under the Plan shall not be subject in any manner to anticipation, alienation, sale, transfer, assignment, pledge, encumbrance, charge, garnishment, execution, or levy of any kind, either voluntary or involuntary, and any
attempt to anticipate, alienate, sell, transfer, assign, pledge, encumber, charge or otherwise dispose of any right to benefits payable hereunder, including any assignment or alienation in connection with a divorce, separation, child support or
similar arrangement, shall be null and void and not binding on the Company. The Company shall not in any manner be liable for, or subject to, the debts, contracts, liabilities, engagements or torts of any person entitled to benefits hereunder.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.3 <U>Unfunded Plan</U>: The Company&#146;s obligations under the Plan shall not be funded, but shall constitute
liabilities by the Company payable when due out of the Company&#146;s general funds. To the extent the Participant or any other person acquires a right to receive benefits under this Plan, such right shall be no greater than the rights of any
unsecured general creditor of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.4 <U>Action by the Company</U>: Any action by the Company under this Plan
may be made by the Board of Directors of the Company or by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors, with a report of any actions taken by it to the Board of Directors. In addition, such action may be made by any other person or persons
duly authorized by resolution of said Board to take such action. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VIII-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.5 <U>Indemnification</U>: Unless the Board of Directors of the Company shall determine
otherwise, the Company shall indemnify, to the full extent permitted by law, any employee acting in good faith within the scope of his employment in carrying out the administration of the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.6 Compliance with Section&nbsp;409A: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>General</U>: It is the intention of the Company that the Plan shall be construed in accordance with the applicable requirements of Section&nbsp;409A. Further, in the event that the Plan
shall be deemed not to comply with Section&nbsp;409A, then neither the Company, the Board of Directors, the Plan Administrator nor its or their designees or agents shall be liable to any Participant or other person for actions, decisions or
determinations made in good faith. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Non-duplication of benefits</U>: In the interest of clarity, and
to determine benefits in compliance with the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A, provisions have been included in this 409A Document describing the calculation of benefits under certain specific circumstances, for example, provisions relating to the
inclusion of salary continuation during certain window severance programs in the calculation of Highest Average Monthly Earnings, as specified in Appendix C. Notwithstanding this or any similar provision, no duplication of benefits may at any time
occur under the Plan. Therefore, to the extent that a specific provision of the Plan provides for recognizing a benefit determining element (such as pensionable earnings or service) and this same element is or could be recognized in some other way
under the Plan, the specific </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VIII-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">provision of the Plan shall govern and there shall be absolutely no duplicate recognition of such element under any other provision of the Plan, or pursuant
to the Plan&#146;s integration with the Salaried Plan. This provision shall govern over any contrary provision of the Plan that might be interpreted to support duplication of benefits. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8.7 <U>Authorized Transfers</U>: If a Participant transfers to an entity that is not part of the PepsiCo Organization, the liability for
any benefits accrued while the Participant was employed by the PepsiCo Organization shall remain with the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">VIII-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE IX </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Amendment and Termination </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Article governs the Company&#146;s right to amend
and or terminate the Plan. The Company&#146;s amendment and termination powers under this Article shall be subject, in all cases, to the restrictions on amendment and termination in Section&nbsp;409A and shall be exercised in accordance with such
restrictions to ensure continued compliance with Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9.1 <U>Continuation of the Plan</U>: While the
Company and the Employers intend to continue the Plan indefinitely, they assume no contractual obligation as to its continuance. In accordance with Section&nbsp;8.4, the Company hereby reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to amend, terminate,
or partially terminate the Plan at any time provided, however, that no such amendment or termination shall adversely affect the amount of benefit to which a Participant or his beneficiary is entitled under Article IV on the date of such amendment or
termination, unless the Participant becomes entitled to an amount equal to such benefit under another plan or practice adopted by the Company (except as necessary to comply with Section&nbsp;409A). Specific forms of payment are not protected under
the preceding sentence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9.2 <U>Amendments</U>: The Company may, in its sole discretion, make any amendment or amendments
to this Plan from time to time, with or without retroactive effect, including any amendment necessary to ensure continued compliance with Section&nbsp;409A. An Employer (other than the Company) shall not have the right to amend the Plan. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9.3 <U>Termination</U>: The Company may terminate the Plan, either as to its participation or as to the participation of one or more
Employers. If the Plan is terminated with respect to fewer than all of the Employers, the Plan shall continue in effect for the benefit of the Employees of the remaining Employers. Upon termination, the distribution of Participants&#146; 409A
Pensions shall be subject to restrictions applicable under Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IX-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9.4 <U>Change in Control</U>: The Company intends to have the maximum discretionary
authority to terminate the Plan and make distributions in connection with a Change in Control (defined as provided in Section&nbsp;409A), and the maximum flexibility with respect to how and to what extent to carry this out following a Change in
Control as is permissible under Section&nbsp;409A. The previous sentence contains the exclusive terms under which a distribution shall be made in connection with any Change in Control in the case of benefits that are derived from this 409A Program.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IX-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE X </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>ERISA Plan Structure </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Plan document in conjunction with the plan document(s)
for the Pre-409A Program encompasses three separate plans within the meaning of ERISA, as are set forth in subsections (a), (b)&nbsp;and (c). This division into separate plans became effective as of July&nbsp;1, 1996; previously the plans set forth
in subsections (b)&nbsp;and (c)&nbsp;were a single plan within the meaning of ERISA. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Excess Benefit
