Plan</U>: An excess benefit plan within the meaning of section 3(36) of ERISA, maintained solely for the purpose of providing benefits for Salaried Plan participants in excess of the limitations on benefits imposed by section 415 of the Code.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Excess Compensation Top Hat Plan</U>: A plan maintained by the Company primarily for the purpose of
providing deferred compensation for a select group of management or highly compensated employees within the meaning of sections 201(2) and 401(a)(1) of ERISA. The plan provides benefits for Salaried Plan participants in excess of the limitations
imposed by section 401(a)(17) of the Code on benefits under the Salaried Plan (after taking into account any benefits under the Excess Benefit Plan). For ERISA reporting purposes, this portion of PEP may be referred to as the PepsiCo Pension
Equalization Plan I. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Preservation Top Hat Plan</U>: A plan maintained by the Company primarily for
the purpose of providing deferred compensation for a select group of management or highly compensated employees within the meaning of sections 201(2) and 401(a)(1) of ERISA. The plan provides preserves benefits for those Salaried Plan </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">X-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">participants described in section 5.2(a) hereof, by preserving for them the pre-1989 level of benefit accrual that was in effect before the Salaried
Plan&#146;s amendment effective January&nbsp;1, 1989 (after taking into account any benefits under the Excess Benefit Plan and Excess Compensation Top Hat Plan). For ERISA reporting purposes, this portion of PEP shall be referred to as the PepsiCo
Pension Equalization Plan II. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Benefits under this Plan shall be allocated first to the Excess Benefit Plan, to the extent of benefits paid
for the purpose indicated in (a)&nbsp;above; then any remaining benefits shall be allocated to the Excess Compensation Top Hat Plan, to the extent of benefits paid for the purpose indicated in (b)&nbsp;above; then any remaining benefits shall be
allocated to the Preservation Top Hat Plan. These three plans are severable for any and all purposes as directed by the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">X-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE XI </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Applicable Law </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">All questions pertaining to the construction, validity and effect
of the Plan shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of ERISA. In the event ERISA is not applicable or does not preempt state law, the laws of the state of New York shall govern. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:10%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If any provision of this Plan is, or is hereafter declared to be, void, voidable, invalid or otherwise unlawful, the remainder of the
Plan shall not be affected thereby. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">XI-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">ARTICLE XII </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>SIGNATURE </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The above Plan is hereby adopted and approved, to be effective as of January&nbsp;1,
2005, this 12th day of December, 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">XII-1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">APPENDIX </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The following Appendix articles modify particular terms of the Plan. Except as specifically modified in the Appendix, the foregoing main provisions of the Plan shall fully apply in determining the rights and benefits
of Participants and beneficiaries (and of any other individual claiming a benefit through or under the foregoing). In the event of a conflict between the Appendix and the foregoing main provision of the Plan, the Appendix shall govern. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">APPENDIX ARTICLE A </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Transition Provisions </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A.1</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Scope</U>. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">This Article A provides the transition rules for the Plan that were effective at some time during the period beginning January&nbsp;1, 2005 and ending December&nbsp;31, 2008 (the &#147;Transition Period&#148;). The time period during which
each provision in this Article A was effective is set forth below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A.2</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Transition Rules for Article II (Definitions)</U>. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Actuarial Equivalent</U>. In addition to the provisions provided in Article II for determining actuarial equivalence under the Plan, for the duration of the Transition Period, to determine
the amount of a Pension payable in the form of a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity or optional form of survivor annuity, as an annuity with inflation protection, or as a Single Life Annuity, the Plan Administrator used the actuarial factors under
the Salaried Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Key Employee</U>. In addition to the provisions provided in Article II for identifying Key
Employees, the following operating rules were in effect for the indicated time periods &#150; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1)
<U>Operating Rules for 2005</U>. To ensure that the Company did not fail to identify any Key Employees, in the case of Separation from Service distributions during the 2005 Plan Year, the Company treated as Key Employees all Participants (and former
Participants) classified (or grandfathered) for any portion of the 2005 Plan Year as Band IV and above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2)
<U>Operating Rules for 2006 and 2007</U>. To ensure that the Company did not fail to identify any Key Employees, in the case of Separation from Service distributions during the 2006 Plan Year and 2007 Plan Year, the Company treated as Key Employees
for such applicable Plan Year of their Separation from Service those individuals who met the provisions of (3)&nbsp;or (4)&nbsp;below (or both). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) The Company shall treat as Key Employees all Participants (and former
Participants) who are classified (or grandfathered) as Band IV and above for any portion of the Plan Year prior to the Plan Year of their Separation from Service; and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(4) The Company shall treat as a Key Employee any Participant who would be a Key Employee as of his or her Separation from
Service date based on the standards in this paragraph (4). For purposes of this paragraph (4), the Company shall determine Key Employees based on compensation (as defined in Code Section&nbsp;415(c)(3)) that is taken into account as follows:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(A) If the determination is in connection with a Separation from Service in the first calendar quarter of
a Plan Year, the determination shall be made using compensation earned in the calendar year that is two years prior to the current calendar year (<I>e.g</I>., for a determination made in the first quarter of 2006, compensation earned in the 2004
calendar year shall be used); and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(B) If the determination is in connection with a Separation from Service
in the second, third or fourth calendar quarter of a Plan Year, the determination shall be made using the compensation earned in the prior calendar year (<I>e.g</I>., for a determination made in the second quarter of 2006, compensation earned in the
2005 calendar year shall be used). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A.3</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Transition Rules for Article VI (Distributions)</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">409A Pensions that would have been paid out during the Transition Period under the provisions set forth in the main body of the Plan (but for the application of permissible transition rules under
Section&nbsp;409A) shall be paid out on March&nbsp;1, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A.4</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Transition Rules for Article VII (Administration)</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Effective during the Transition Period, the language of Section&nbsp;8.6(a) shall be replaced in its entirety with the following language: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#147;8.6(a) <U>Compliance with Section&nbsp;409A</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">At all times during each Plan Year, this Plan shall be operated (i)&nbsp;in accordance with the requirements of
Section&nbsp;409A, and (ii)&nbsp;to preserve the status of deferrals under the Pre-409A Program as being exempt from Section&nbsp;409A, i.e., to preserve the grandfathered status of the Pre-409A Program. Any action that may be taken (and, to the
extent possible, any action actually taken) by the Plan Administrator or the Company shall not be taken (or shall be void and without effect), if such action violates the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A or if such action would adversely affect the
grandfather of the Pre-409A Program. If the failure to take an action under the Plan would violate Section&nbsp;409A, then to the extent it is possible thereby to avoid a violation of Section&nbsp;409A, the rights and effects under the Plan shall be
altered to avoid such violation. A corresponding rule shall apply with respect to a failure to take an action that would adversely affect the grandfather of the Pre-409A Program. Any provision in this Plan document that is determined to violate the
requirements of Section&nbsp;409A or to adversely affect the grandfather of the Pre-409A Program shall be void and without effect. In addition, any provision that is required to appear in this Plan document to satisfy the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">requirements of Section&nbsp;409A, but that is not expressly set forth, shall be deemed to be set forth herein, and the Plan shall be administered in all
respects as if such provision were expressly set forth. A corresponding rule shall apply with respect to a provision that is required to preserve the grandfather of the Pre-409A Program. In all cases, the provisions of this Section shall apply
notwithstanding any contrary provision of the Plan that is not contained in this Section.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A.5</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Transition Rules for Severance Benefits</U>. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Effective during the Transition Period, the following provisions shall apply according to their specified terms. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>Definitions</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) Where the following words and phrases, in
boldface and underlined, appear in this Section A.5 with initial capitals they shall have the meaning set forth below, unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context. Any terms used in this Article A of the Appendix with initial
capitals and not defined herein shall have the same meaning as in the main Plan, unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) &#147;<B><U>Special Early Retirement</U></B>&#148; shall mean the Participant&#146;s attainment of at least age 50 but less than age 55 with 10 years of Elapsed Time Service as of the date of
his Retirement, provided, however, that with respect to the 2008 Severance at Section A.5(d), for purposes of determining whether a Participant has met the age and service requirements, a Participant&#146;s age and years of Elapsed Time Service are
rounded up to the nearest whole year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>2005 Severance</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Non-Retirement Eligible Employees</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2005 as a result of a
severance window program and who was not eligible for Retirement as of the date of his Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document, provided, however,
that the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension will be paid at the same time as his Salaried Plan benefit. The available forms of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2
of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Non-Retirement Eligible Employees with Payments in 2007</U>: With respect to
any Participant who terminated in 2005 as a result of a severance window program, who was not eligible for Retirement as of the date of his Separation from Service, and whose 409A Pension Payment would otherwise be paid during 2007, the
Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document, provided, however, that the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension will be paid at the later of (i)&nbsp;January&nbsp;1, 2007 or
(ii)&nbsp;when the Participant attained age 55. The available forms of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) <U>Retirement Eligible Employees:</U> With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2005 as a result of a
severance window program and who fulfilled the requirements for either a Normal or Early Retirement Pension under Article IV of the Plan document as of February&nbsp;5, 2006, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the
month following the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service in a lump sum. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(4) <U>Retirement Eligible Employees (With Credit)</U>: With respect to
any Participant who terminated in 2005 as a result of a severance window program and who fulfilled the requirements for either a Normal or Early Retirement Pension under Article IV of the Plan document as of his Separation from Service as a result
of being provided additional Credited Service time by the Company, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service in a lump sum. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(5) <U>Special Early Retirement Eligible</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2005 as a result of a
severance window program and who fulfilled the requirements to be eligible for Special Early Retirement as of his Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the month following the
Participant&#146;s Separation from Service in a lump sum. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>2007 Severance</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Non-Retirement Eligible Employees</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2007 as a result of a
severance window program and who was not eligible for Retirement as of the date of his Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document. The available forms
of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Retirement Eligible Employees</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2007 as a result of a severance window program and who fulfilled the requirements for either a Normal
or Early Retirement Pension under Article IV of the Plan document as of his Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service in a lump sum; provided, however, that if a Participant made a
valid Prior Payment Election under Section&nbsp;6.1(a)(2) of the Plan document, his 409A Pension shall be paid according to such election. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) <U>Employee Who Become Retirement Eligible</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>409A
Pension</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2007 as a result of a severance window program and who fulfilled the requirements for either a Normal or Early Retirement Pension under Article IV of the Plan document between his
Separation from Service and the last day of his paid leave of absence (if any), the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the month following the later of (i)&nbsp;Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55 and (ii)&nbsp;his
Separation from Service; the 409A Pension shall be paid as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document. The available forms of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set
forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <U>PEP Kicker</U>: Any amount paid to a Participant
otherwise described under this paragraph (3)&nbsp;as a replacement for benefits that the Participant could have earned under the Plan but for his Separation from Service shall be paid as a single lump sum, provided, however, that if a Participant
made a valid Prior Payment Election under Section&nbsp;6.1(a)(2) of the Plan document, the amounts described in this subparagraph (ii)&nbsp;shall be paid according to such election. All amounts to be paid shall be paid on the first day of the month
following the later of (i)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55 or (ii)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(4) <U>Special Retirement Eligible Employees</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>409A Pension</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2007 as a result of a severance window program
and who fulfilled the requirements to be eligible for Special Early Retirement as of his Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55
as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document. The available forms of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <U>PEP Kicker</U>: Any amount paid to a Participant otherwise described under this paragraph
(4)&nbsp;as a replacement for benefits that the Participant could have earned under the Plan but for his Separation from Service shall be paid as a single lump sum, provided, however, that if a Participant made a valid Prior Payment Election under
Section&nbsp;6.1(a)(2) of the Plan document, the amounts described in this subparagraph (ii)&nbsp;shall be paid according to such election. All amounts to be paid shall be paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s
attainment of age 55. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(5) <U>Employees Who Become Special Retirement Eligible</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>409A Pension</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2007 as a result of a severance window program
and who fulfilled the requirements to be eligible for Special Early Retirement during the period between his Separation from Service and the last day of his paid leave of absence </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(if any), the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55 as a Vested
Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document. The available forms of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <U>PEP Kicker</U>: Any amount paid to a Participant otherwise described under this paragraph (5)&nbsp;as a
replacement for benefits that the Participant could have earned under the Plan but for his Separation from Service shall be paid as a single lump sum, provided, however, that if a Participant made a valid Prior Payment Election under
Section&nbsp;6.1(a)(2) of the Plan document, the amounts described in this subparagraph (ii)&nbsp;shall be paid according to such election. All amounts to be paid shall be paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s
attainment of age 55. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(d) <U>2008 Severance</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) <U>Non-Retirement Eligible Employees</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2008 as a result of a
severance window program and who was not eligible for Retirement as of the date of his Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document. The available forms
of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) <U>Retirement Eligible Employees</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2008 as a result of a severance window program and who fulfilled the requirements for either a Normal
or Early Retirement Pension under Article IV of the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Plan document as of his Separation from Service, the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the month following the
Participant&#146;s Separation from Service in a lump sum; provided, however, that if a Participant made a valid Prior Payment Election under Section&nbsp;6.1(a)(2) of the Plan document, his 409A Pension shall be paid according to such election.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(3) <U>Employee Who Become Retirement Eligible</U>: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>409A Pension</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2008 as a result of a severance window program
and who fulfilled the requirements for either a Normal or Early Retirement Pension under Article IV of the Plan document between his Separation from Service and the last day of his paid leave of absence (if any), the Participant&#146;s 409A Pension
shall be paid on the first day of the month following the later of (i)&nbsp;Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55 and (ii)&nbsp;his Separation from Service; the 409A Pension shall be paid as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan
document. The available forms of payment shall be those forms available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <U>PEP Kicker</U>: Any amount paid to a Participant otherwise described under this paragraph (3)&nbsp;as a
replacement for benefits that the Participant could have earned under the Plan but for his Separation from Service shall be paid as a single lump sum, provided, however, that if a Participant made a valid Prior Payment Election under
Section&nbsp;6.1(a)(2) of the Plan document, the amounts described in this subparagraph (ii)&nbsp;shall be paid according to such election. All amounts to be paid shall be paid on the first day of the month following the later of
(i)&nbsp;Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55 or (ii)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(4) <U>Employees Who Are or Become Special Retirement Eligible</U>:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i) <U>409A Pension</U>: With respect to any Participant who terminated in 2008 as a result of a severance
window program and who fulfilled the requirements to be eligible for Special Early Retirement as of his Separation from Service or during the period between his Separation from Service and the last day of his paid leave of absence (if any), the
Participant&#146;s 409A Pension shall be paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55 as a Vested Pension under Section&nbsp;6.1(b) of the Plan document. The available forms of payment shall be those forms
available to a Participant who is entitled to a Vested Pension, as set forth in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:10%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii) <U>PEP Kicker</U>: Any amount paid to a Participant otherwise described under this paragraph (4)&nbsp;as a replacement for benefits that the Participant could have earned under the Plan but for his Separation
from Service shall be paid as a single lump sum, provided, however, that if a Participant made a valid Prior Payment Election under Section&nbsp;6.1(a)(2) of the Plan document, the amounts described in this subparagraph (ii)&nbsp;shall be paid
according to such election. All amounts to be paid shall be paid on the first day of the month following the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(e) <U>Delay for Key Employees</U>: To the extent that a Participant is a Key Employee (as defined in Section A.2(b), above) with respect to any payment provided under this Section A.5, and to the extent that payment
of his 409A Pension is on account of his Separation from Service, his 409A Pension shall be subject to the delay in payment provided under Section&nbsp;6.6 of the main Plan document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(f) <U>Compliance with 19(c)</U>: All payments that are to be made under this Section A.5
were scheduled to made during the calendar year in which the Participant terminated employment, with payments to be made as provided herein. All elections made by the Company with respect to such payments were made in compliance with Notice 2005-1
and other provisions of Code Section&nbsp;409A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A.6</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Certain Participants</U> </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The following transition rules shall apply only with respect to the following described Participants: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) A Participant&#146;s PEP Credited Service shall be deemed to be five years if the Participant terminates employment in 2005 while classified as Band VI (or equivalent), and his employment with an Employer was for
a limited duration assignment of less than five years. A Participant shall be deemed to be vested for purposes of this Plan if the Participant terminates employment in 2005 while classified as Band VI (or equivalent), and his employment with an
Employer was for a limited duration assignment of less than five years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) In the case of a Participant who on
October&nbsp;9, 2007 selects an Annuity Starting Date of November&nbsp;1, 2007 for the Participant&#146;s Pension under the Salaried Plan which is payable in a single lump sum (after taking into account the special rule in Section&nbsp;6.3(a)(2), if
necessary), the portion of the Participant&#146;s benefit under the Plan that is <U>not</U> subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code shall be paid in a single lump sum six months after the Participant&#146;s Annuity Starting Date under the Salaried
Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">13 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) In the case of a Participant who on September&nbsp;3, 2004 selects a fixed date of
payment of February&nbsp;1, 2005 for the Participant&#146;s Pension under the Plan, the following provisions shall apply: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) such fixed date shall be the commencement date for the Participant&#146;s benefit under the Plan, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) the calculation of the Participant&#146;s benefit under the Plan shall be made taking into account service to be performed during any period for which the Participant is to provide consulting services to the
Company, even if such services are to be performed after the payment date specified in paragraph (1). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">14 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">APPENDIX ARTICLE B </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Computation of Earnings and Service During Certain Severance Windows </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">B.1</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Definitions</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">Where the following words and phrases, in boldface and underlined, appear in this Appendix C with initial capitals they shall have the meaning set forth below, unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context. Any terms used in
this Article B of the Appendix with initial capitals and not defined herein shall have the same meaning as in the main Plan, unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) &#147;<B><U>Severance Program</U></B>&#148; shall mean a program providing certain severance benefits that are paid while the
program&#146;s participants are on a severance leave of absence that is determined by the Plan Administrator to qualify for recognition as Service under Section B.3 and Credited Service under Section B.4 of Article B. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) &#147;<B><U>Eligible Bonus</U></B>&#148; shall mean an annual incentive payment that is payable to the Participant under the
Severance Program and that is identified under the terms of the Severance Program as eligible for inclusion in determining the Participant&#146;s Highest Average Monthly Earnings. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">B.2</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Inclusion of Salary and Eligible Bonus</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Plan Administrator may specify that, pursuant to a Participant&#146;s participation in a severance window program provided by the Company, if a Participant receives a severance benefit pursuant to a Severance
Program, all salary continuation and any Eligible Bonus earned or to be earned during the first 12 months of a leave of absence period provided to the Participant under such Severance Program will be counted toward the Participant&#146;s Highest
Average Monthly Earnings, even if such salary or other earnings are to be received after a Participant&#146;s Separation from Service. In particular, if payment of a Participant&#146;s 409A Pension is to be made </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">15 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">at Separation from Service and prior to the Participant&#146;s receipt of all of the salary continuation or Eligible Bonus that is payable to the Participant
from the Severance Program, the Participant&#146;s Highest Average Monthly Earnings shall be determined by taking into account the full salary continuation and eligible bonus that is projected to be payable to the Participant during the first 12
months of a period of leave of absence that is granted to the Participant under the Severance Program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">B.3</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Inclusion of Credited Service</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Plan Administrator may specify that, pursuant to a Participant&#146;s participation in a severance window program provided by the Company, if a Participant receives a severance benefit under a Severance Program,
all Credited Service earned or to be earned during the first 12 months of the period of severance will be counted toward the Participant&#146;s Credited Service for purposes of determining the Participant&#146;s Pension and a Pre-Retirement
Spouse&#146;s Pension, even if the period of time counted as Credited Service under the Severance Program occurs after a Participant&#146;s Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">B.4</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Inclusion of Service</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Plan Administrator may specify that, pursuant to a Participant&#146;s participation in a severance window program provided by the Company, if a Participant receives a severance benefit under a Severance Program,
all Service earned or to be earned during the first 12 months of the period of severance will be counted toward the Participant&#146;s Service for purposes of determining the Participant&#146;s Pension and a Pre-Retirement Spouse&#146;s Pension,
even if the period of time counted as Service under the Severance Program occurs after a Participant&#146;s Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">16 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">B.5</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Reduction to Reflect Early Payment</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If the Participant receives either (1)&nbsp;additional Credited Service or (2)&nbsp;additional earnings that are included in Highest Average Monthly Earnings under Sections B.2 or B.3 of this Article B, as a result of
a severance benefit provided under a Severance Program and such additional Credited Service or earnings are included in the calculation of the Participant&#146;s Pension prior to the time that the Credited Service is actually performed by the
Participant, or the earnings are actually paid to the Participant, the Pension paid to the Participant shall be adjusted actuarially to reflect the receipt of the portion of the Pension attributable to such Credited Service or earnings received on
account of the Severance Program prior to the time such Credited Service is performed or such earnings are actually paid to the Participant. For purposes of determining the adjustment to be made, the Plan shall use the rate provided under the
Salaried Plan for early payment of benefits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">17 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">APPENDIX ARTICLE C </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>International Transfer Participants </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">C.1</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Scope</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">This Article provides special rules for calculating the benefit of an individual who is an &#147;International Transfer Participant&#148; under Section C.2 below. The benefit of an International Transfer Participant shall be determined
under Section C. 3 below, subject to Section C.4 below. Once a benefit is determined for an International Transfer Participant under this Article, such benefit shall be subject to the Plan&#146;s normal conditions and shall be paid in accordance
with the Plan&#146;s normal terms. All benefits paid under this Article are subject to Code section 409A, including those accrued prior to January&nbsp;1, 2005. This Article is effective April&nbsp;1, 2007. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">C.2</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>International Transfer Participants</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">An International Transfer Participant is a Participant who is: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a) <U>General Rule</U>: An
individual who, following a transfer to an April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary (as defined under Section&nbsp;2.1(r)(5) of the Salaried Plan), would qualify as an Employee within the meaning of Section&nbsp;2.1(q)(2)(vi) of the Salaried Plan (U.S. citizen
or resident alien on qualifying temporary international assignment) but for the fact that his assignment with the April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary is in a position of employment that is classified as Band 4 (or its equivalent) or higher; or </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(b) <U>Special Rule for Certain Permanent Assignments to Mexico</U>: Notwithstanding subsection (a)&nbsp;above, an International
Transfer Participant also includes an individual who was transferred to an April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary based in Mexico, and who would qualify as an Employee within the meaning of Section&nbsp;2.1(q)(2)(vi) of the Salaried Plan but for the fact
that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) His assignment with the April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary is in a position that is classified as Band
4 (or its equivalent) or higher; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">18 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) Mexico is his home country on the records of the Expat Centre for
Excellence group or its successor (in accordance with Section&nbsp;2.1(q)(2)(vi) of the Salaried Plan); and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">(3) The duration of his assignment with the April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary in Mexico is not limited to 5 years or less. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">An
individual described in subsection (a)&nbsp;or (b)&nbsp;above may still qualify as an International Transfer Participant if his transfer to an April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary occurred prior to April&nbsp;1, 2007 (the effective date of this Article),
provided he satisfied the terms of subsection (a)&nbsp;or (b)&nbsp;above on the date of his transfer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">C.3</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Benefit Formula for International Transfer Participants</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Except as provided in this Section C.3, an International Transfer Participant&#146;s benefit under the Plan shall be determined using a calculation methodology that is substantially similar to
that which applies under Section&nbsp;5.1 of the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(c) <U>Total Pension for International Transfer Participant</U>:
Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, an International Transfer Participant&#146;s &#147;Total Pension&#148; (as defined in Section&nbsp;5.1(c)(1) of the Plan) shall be calculated as if he continued to receive Credited Service and Earnings under
the Salaried Plan while working for the April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary to which he transferred following his employment with an Employer based in the United States, without regard to the actual date on which he ceased receiving Credited Service and
Earnings under the Salaried Plan. However, the Total Pension of an International Transfer Participant whose transfer to an April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary occurred prior to 1992 shall not take into account Credited Service and Earnings for employment
with the April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary prior to 1992. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">19 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(d) <U>Calculation of International Transfer Participant&#146;s Benefit</U>: The
International Transfer Participant&#146;s benefit under the Plan shall be calculated by reducing his Total Pension as determined under subsection (a)&nbsp;above (expressed as a lump sum as of his benefit commencement date under the Plan) by the
following amounts: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(1) The amount of his actual benefit under the Salaried Plan (expressed as a lump sum
amount on his benefit commencement date), and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(2) Any amounts paid to him from a &#147;qualifying
plan&#148; as that term is defined under Section&nbsp;3.6(c)(4) of the Salaried Plan (Transfers and Non-Duplication) with respect to his assignment with the April 2007 Foreign Subsidiary (with such amounts expressed as a lump sum on his benefit
commencement date under this Plan). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">C.4</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Alternative Arrangements Permitted</U>: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Notwithstanding any provision of this Article or the Plan to the contrary, the Company and a Participant who would qualify as an International Transfer Participant under Section C.2 above may agree in writing to
disregard the provisions of this Article in favor of another mutually agreed upon benefit arrangement under the Plan, in which case this Article shall not apply. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">20 </FONT></P>

</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-12
<SEQUENCE>3
